So the movie starts and I'm wondering if we wondered into Harry Potter, with the candles and everything, but it wasn't, because I don't think Brent Spiner was in Harry Potter. But it starts- and it goes- for quite a bit, and I wonder if maybe I'd better go to sleep. Even when Carvey shows up, his Italian accent is SO IRRITATING I still wonder about dozing off, if that's even possible anymore. Not a great beginning by any means.But wait...sun shining through the clouds a little? Well, my little sister's laughing anyway. So okay, Carvey's charming a snake. Well, he charms me if he's trying hard enough, so the snake's no big deal. So what? Okay...he's dressed as a turtle. Oh my gosh! He's a big turtle with a bald head and a pointy lip and he's bugging everybody and THE AUDIENCE IS GOING WILD!!! I'm sorry, but I have to stand in Carvey's defense. The main character is a bit of a one-joke, and the joke isn't all that good (keep away from 'funny names'). But the people he slides in as are funny! The turtle, the old lady, the, the, the, and my personal favorite, the British Fellow. I love the British, even if they do look like Dana Carvey and actually aren't British. The British Fellow was my favorite. And the fact is, after the movie got going, and except a few parts when Carvey was being Pistachio (one-jokio) the movie was very funny and good for an entertaining evening, especially if you're with somebody of a youthful mentality who laughs at every fart that comes off the screen (okay, so it was funny once, but they shouldn't have put it in every time). It was ridiculous and fairly badly-written and it wasn't the dialogue that was funny, but the characters! SNL's wild cat is on the movie screen again. Plus I was picturing Carvey teasing Mike Myers about it ("Wooh! Whupped YOUR butt, didn't I?") And frankly, the only un-enjoyable thing that evening was the idiot teenaged boys we were sitting next to. Every time there was one of the less tush-deficient ladies on screen, they were...well, making noises. I was driven to adopting my best Graham Chapman voice and saying "Shut up, you loopy brothel inmate!!!" Well, no, not really, I made that up. Anyway, the movie really brightened my day, and I laughed all the way home, causing great concern to my parents, who had only seen Austen Powers and therefore couldn't figure out what there was left to live for in the world.

reviews.review_title: Too bad this "movie" can't disguise itself as a comedy.
reviews.content: "The Master of Disguise" (2002), this might as well be called "How Not to Make a Movie". This "film" is yet another one of the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen. I remember when this "film" first came out, I was in elementary school. Back then, I was kind of interested in seeing it. But, I never got around to it, or even buying it on video. Yep, that was still during the VHS transitioning to DVD era. I never saw it when it was first released, and thank God for that! Just over ten years later, I saw it On Demand for free. So, I thought: "why not? I think I'll give it a watch." What a waste of 80 minutes of my life! I'm just all the more grateful that I didn't watch it as a kid. If I did, it would most likely have taken away half of my brain. Seriously, who green-lit this steaming pile of garbage?! This "movie" has a boring story, horrible acting, dated special effects, dull sets/locations, and a cheap generic soundtrack. The "story", or lack thereof, is one of the most dull and cliched I have ever seen. When I watched it, there was no laughter, there was no enjoyment, nothing salvageable at all! This "movie" is only 80 minutes, so it doesn't sound like it's that long. But when I saw it, it felt like I was watching it for days! Another thing, is that this "movie" has an extremely long end credit sequence. For a movie to clock in as a feature film, it has to be a minimum of 70 minutes to reach movie length standards. The "movie" ends after 65 minutes of runtime, and then there's the infamous 10 minutes plus end credit sequence, but even that's not the end. After the credits, there's not one, not two, but three post-credit scenes! All three of them go absolutely nowhere, and tie into nothing, just like the rest of this "film". However, there are movies where a long end credit sequence can work if it goes along with the context of the film itself. Like, if you want to showcase some bloopers, a behind the scenes featurette, etc. When executed properly, long end credits can be fun to watch! But that is not the case for this "movie". One thing to point out, the "most popular" scene is the Turtle Club scene. That, supposedly, is supposed to be the comedic highlight. It appeared the most frequent in all the commercials and trailers. Believe me, I know! But, when I watched it, I was very disappointed (big shock). It's nothing but Dana Carvey in a cheaply made costume shouting "turtle" over and over again. Boring! As for the acting, where on Earth do I begin? All of the actors do a horrible job, especially Dana Carvey, who plays the main character, Pistachio Disguisey. No, seriously.... That's his name! Before I tear apart Dana Carvey's performance, I just want to say one thing. I don't hate him as an actor overall, Dana Carvey is a great comedian. He has played good roles in other movies, and I do enjoy watching clips of him on "Saturday Night Live". Dana Carvey is famous for voice impersonations, and that is the concept idea for "The Master of Disguise". Now that's a decent idea, and it surely had potential. But it was just so poorly executed! Dana Carvey gave one of the unfunniest performances I have ever seen. He just smiles with his mouth partially open for 95% of the time. Listen, that may entertain kids under five years old for an hour. But if you're older than that, watching that expression for over a minute will want you to pull your hair out! Don't even get me started on his over the top accent. Wow, as if his annoying expression wasn't bad enough! As far as the rest of the actors and actresses performances go, they all suck pretty much as bad as Dana Carvey's. The special effects are dated, and have not aged well. All of the sets/locations are dull and boring, and all the interior scenes are obviously filmed on a sound stage. Now I don't want you to think I'm against sound stages, when utilized properly, they can look like a real life setting. A movie with perfect use of sound stages is "Flubber" (1997). Most of the interior scenes are filmed in a studio, but are properly laid out so it's not obvious where it's actually filmed. Back to "The Master of Disguise" review. As far as the soundtrack goes, it's just as cheap and generic as the rest of the "movie". Bottom line, there is nothing positive I can salvage from this waste of film making. I'm giving this "film" 0 out of 5 stars on my scale. If I could rate it 0 stars I would, but 1 is as low as I can go. Ignore the 1 star rating, my true rating is 0 stars. "The Master of Disguise" is a waste of cinema, and is not worth watching even if you have an opportunity to watch it for free. Life is too short to watch it, go watch real movies instead. Turtle!
I don't know about you but this movie is hilarious

reviews.review_title: It's a kids movie - and one that they love!
reviews.content: I was a mere 8 year old when I first saw this movie.I fell in love! This was a movie I rematched 15 times per week.20 years later, I sat down and watched it with my 6yo, 4yo and 1yo.While it didn't entertain me the way it did as a kid, it is still an enjoyable KIDS movie.And the kids... They couldn't stop laughing! Just like I remember being those many years ago.The reviews for this movie are harsh. Rating it on their personal opinions as an ADULT about a KIDS movie. YOU AREN'T THE MARKET!To my kids, this movie is 10/10.It's easy to watch as a parent, so I say that's a win. 8/10.

I like Dana Carvey very much; however, I did not get one laugh out of this "comedy."  It was the worst 1 1/2 hours I have ever wasted. I cannot believe that anybody would waste the time, money or film for this absolutely ridiculous attempt at a comedy.

The Master of Disguise was awful. Awful is putting it lightly. There is not a single word in the English dictionary to describe how bad this movie was. Dana Carvey please never star in another movie again, just throw in the towel. Perry Andelin Blake please never direct another movie as long as you live. Honestly I'm contemplating suing Mr. Blake for wasting 1 1/2 hours of my life. Your last hit movie was ten years ago (Happy Glimore). The Master of Disguise was a waste of money. Wasn't funny at all. The only joke that was semi funny was the turtle joke which I saw in the previews. Consider this your warning, don't waste your time or your money on The Master of Disguise.

reviews.review_title: I become another person by Hindu magic becoming another person
reviews.content: Pistachio is a real nut case in this film. But once he observes his Grandfathers advice he quickly learns how to become another person. Using Hindu magic he learns to become another person. Once he becomes another person then he can pursue being a "Master of Disguise". This movie seems kinda like the dumbest re-make of Mission Impossible ever. Becoming another person to stop the world's most flagellate man from collecting art in the form of rare political articles seems to be the movies objective. Data from the movie series Star Trek Next Generation needs to be using the political form of propaganda used by Portugese and Spanish talk shows to model for Beano. (Ohio State's political and congressional gas buster of choice.)

reviews.review_title: The truly sad thing about it is...
reviews.content: ...I actually enjoyed the movie. I've always been a fan of Dana Carvey's, but as a general rule, I prefer his more...'realistic'...films. Namely, I liked 'Opportunity Knocks'. (So sue me, I'm a child of the '80s.) But while this movie had no storyline, no plot, and no really redeeming qualities, I actually got a laugh out of it. I went into this movie expecting cheesy schlock...y'know, like 'The Animal', 'Little Nicky', 'Wayne's World', etc. Not bad, per se, just would never win an academy award. This movie was the cheesiest of the cheesy. But Carvey's character was just so irritatingly cute in some areas, that I couldn't help but laugh.I would never add this movie to a collection, nor would I go out of my way to watch it again...it falls into the 'Zoolander' category of 'well, I saw it, it was kind of neat, but...I'd rather have bridge work without anaesthesia' category...but I did enjoy the one and only time I ever saw it. Probably because my expectations were so...I was pleased to find there was a little comedy in this movie.Ah, well...back to the slice 'em and dice 'em horrors that keep my interest these days. Star rating? Well, Dana Carvey gives it a two. ;)

My pre-teen kids loved the DVD edition of "The Master of Disguise." I also laughed out loud during a number of scenes. Dana Carvey's Turtle Man disguise and performance is as good as any Peter Sellars turn; his homage to Robert Shaw's Captain Quint in "Jaws" should have been given a fuller platform; his invention of a high end, antique auction matron vis-a-vis Kate Hepburn and Hermoine Gingold and his send up of a David Niven espionage operative were spectacularly funny. A linear story with believable main characters and situations are not always a requirement for children but would have carried Carvey's talent in a much more enteraining fashion.That said, Harold Gould, James Brolin and Jennifer Esposito deserve, if one exists, the Screen Actors Guild version pf a Purple Heart. Each performed bravely and beautifully in an amiable and harmless mess which probably wounded their careers but was not of their making.I hope Mr. Carvey is forgiven and gets another shot at a full movie.

reviews.review_title: they should rename this movie, "When filmmakers get high"
reviews.content: some rainy, cold, day in 2001, a group of movie makers got together and started talking about what good movies they have ideas of. the only problem was, that it was at a bar. after about 2 hours they were all insanely drunk. then they started naming ideas, like, hey! lets have terrible acting in a movie! another one said, yeah! and tons of forced unfunny humor! another said, no movie would be complete w/o decent acting! then last off, another one said,"and lets tie it all together w/ a storyline that makes no sense and is embarrassingly dumb! they all combined their ideas and made, "The Master of Disguise" and it was everything they hoped it would be.

reviews.review_title: Dumb. Don't go! Might give away some of the details, so don't read if you have not seen it yet!
reviews.content: I was quite excited to see this movie, as I really like Dana Carvey's work on SNL.  But this movie over all was a real disappointment.  What is the story exactly?  There are some funny moments, but there is a lot of garbage stuff in between them.  The best part of the movie as far as I am concerned was after the credits started.  Only then did I get to see what attracted me to the movie in the first place, seeing Dana in the different disguises he did, and some that I don't actually remember seeing in the film.  The ones they show on the commercial are not that funny when put into the actual movie.  Unfortunately, most people get up and leave when the credits start because they assume the movie is over.  In most movies the movie is over when the credits start.  Here, there was another 10 minutes of footage after the credits!  But the plot is stupid, and in the role of Pistacio or whatever, Dana's accent is so fake.  It started feeling kind of like a warm and fuzzy Disney movie in the beginning, but then it just goes into Dana's character constantly acting like a jerk.  And as for Brent Spiner's characters running gag, it dulls quickly.  I would not recommend this one to anyone, save your money.  And to Dana, this is not your usual calibre of effort, what gives?

reviews.review_title: They showed all the good scenes on the trailer.
reviews.content: Spoiler!!The problem with this film is that they showed all the good scenes on the trailer.  It was not a bad movie, but they ruined the surprise of the funny scenes.  It had a lot of stupid humour in it.  I would not say it was a kids' movie.  I especially liked the part where he disguised himself as Tony Montana (Scarface).  This is one for renting not seeing it on the big screen.  5/10

reviews.review_title: No way is this worthy of being in bottom 100
reviews.content: I am surprised by the vitriol this movie is getting. It was very humorous to me. The people giving it 1's to 4's just don't know what truly bad is. I am 48 so I can say I've probably seen a lot more bad movies than most and this does not deserve that label. Sure the direction and plot could have been better, but I could say that about a lot of movies. I have had my cable disconnected for about 8 years so I did not know Jennifer Esposito before seeing her in this movie. I liked her so much I looked her up in IMDB to see what else she had done. I got the DVD(after the price was reduced) and learned that they had thought of making "The Cuteness" the grandfather in disguise. I am glad that impossible nonsense was cut, It would have cut my rating by 2 points. My rating 7.

reviews.review_title: Minimal value, not recommended for any age
reviews.content: What eye-catching opening credits! What a cast list! What marvelous production design, and art direction! I've been well aware of the film's reputation from the time it was released, but I admit some aspects impressed me after curiosity won out and I began watching. The picture is popping with color both literal and figurative in the set design and decoration, costume design, hair and makeup, and lighting. In smaller, more careful moments of interaction between characters, I think the ensemble illustrates some of the acting abilities we know they have, demonstrating some cheeky nuance. Why, as silly as it is, I think the concept has strong possibilities as an outlandish comedy. And the sound design! Even on a basic, cost-friendly laptop, the audio experience is frankly incredible.I'd love to say that 'The master of disguise' surprised me, and was characterized with still more quality than I anticipated. But that's simply not the case. There are, in fact, some instances where the humor is just right, where the movie achieves a level of farcical energy that earns a laugh or two. These are far outnumbered by instances in which the comedy is hopelessly cheap and juvenile - such as a recurring quirk illustrated by the villain - or outright scatological. Bewilderingly blunt, plainspoken jokes and sight gags, if done right, can add an unexpected cheeky spark to a scene; here, they mostly fall very, very flat. Referential humor is rarely clever, and only dates the picture, while modern pop songs are emphatically inserted at times when they could hardly be less appropriate. The sheer number of costume changes that star and co-writer Dana Carvey has through the runtime is supposed to lend to the exaggerated fun, but that fun is missing in the first place, and the costume changes instead only seem pointless. And then there are the fat jokes, the racist stereotypes, xenophobic caricatures, and sexism.In fairness, there's no mistaking that this feature is intended as a kid's movie. The unswerving simplicity of the plot development informs as much, as well as a lot of the dialogue, and no one but an adolescent could possibly find some of the humor here actually funny. With that said - maybe I was just born a cynic, but I recognize in 'The master of disguise' an astonishingly low grade of would-be amusement. I know to a certainty that if I were 8 years old and seeing this for the first time, I would have been altogether embarrassed to watch it with another person, and I probably wouldn't have enjoyed it any more then than I have now.This is well made from a technical standpoint, and I do appreciate the contributions of the cast, but what does this truly matter when the comedy is so abysmal? As if to emphasize the point, the small clips shown throughout the end credits, including bloopers, are far actively engaging than the feature, with more (unrealized) potential for laughs. I gave it a try, I really did - I've watched plenty of films that were not regarded well, only to be delighted by how good I thought they were. This is not one of those films. 'The master of disguise' not only consciously rejects the intelligence we know Carvey is capable of as a comedic actor, but frankly patronizes children with its assumption that only the most base humor will provide their amusement. What value this does possess - and it does, indeed, have slivers of value - is far outweighed by tedious, unfunny pablum. Sure enough, there are worse movies you could watch, but few that are as visible and easy to find as this one is.Not recommendable, for any age group.

reviews.review_title: A film for the very young-at-heart (or the very simple-minded)
reviews.content: I fully expected this film to be a vehicle for Carvey's numerous parodies as seen while a successful cast member of Saturday Night Live. In fact, this is what I was counting on. Instead, I was subjected to the most purile and sophomoric humor I have had to endure in a very long time. The entire film seems to have been haphazardly constructed to string together the many character impersonations he has developed, unfortunately, at the expense of an actual plot.The result is a disjointed storyline that even the pre-pubescent target audience must have found confusing, if not down right annoying. Considering that this film was obviously meant for a much younger viewer than the previews would have you believe, I was shocked when at one point in the story, Pistachio is taught that it is wrong to strike someone with a closed fist, but perfectly acceptable to slap them with an open palm, a technique used heavily throughout the film.Unless you are under the age of six, or just a die-hard Dana Carvey fan who can't miss a single one of his performances, I highly suggest you steer clear of this dog.

Decided to view this film simple because of the title and I was probably thinking about Lon Chaney and his many faces of Horror. Well, this film was a horrible mess and a big Horror to watch. I will have to say that Dana Carvey,(Pistachio Disguisey),"The Shot",'96 did a great job of acting crazy and I am sure it was not easy to follow the script. Jennifer Esposito,(Jennifer Baker),"Crash",'04, was rather cute and very attractive and gave a good supporting role. Last but not least, James Brolin,(Fabbrizio Disguisey),"A Guy Thing",'03, added his talents to this picture, but I began to wonder if Barbra Streisand enjoyed this film and her husband's performance. WOW

First and foremost people have to understand that Dana Carvey made this movie for his kids and for them alone pretty much.  I saw him on David Letterman and he explained that one day his kids found a bunch of his SNL, magazine, Wayne's World stuff, etc. in their basement and were like "Dad, why didn't you tell us you were famous?"  Then he realized that he has never done anything that he would really want his kids to watch at their age (I think they are like 5 and 7), so he made this movie.  So to the other reviewers who don't think this is a kids a movie, not only it is so, but its a Dana Carvey's kids movie.  Its a couple of laughs, but probably not worth the $7 to see it in theatres.  I took my 10 year old brother to see it and he loved it.  Jennifer Epositzo is hot too, we need her in more films!

reviews.review_title: This is a great film for the whole family
reviews.content: Okay, here's the thing. If you want a movie to enjoy with the whole family, this is it. My four-year-old son laughs and laughs along with the rest of us at the silliness of it all. Dana is great, all his disguises are funny, and it is neat to watch him do so many in one film. Brent Spinner is really a gas as the villain. The love interest in the film is good too. The film is worth watching many times. And watch for a reference to a scene in Ace Ventura two. Ace, says, let me introduce you to my little friend". There is no foul language. Furthermore, the cinematography is brilliant. The sound engineering is impeccable, especially the Brent Spinner sound effects. I highly recommend this film.

reviews.review_title: Adults will laugh, but it's for kids
reviews.content: A lot of people were kind of thrown by this move, they claim it was a waste of their time, etc.  They were expecting the old Dana Carvey from Saturday Night Live, or Wayne's World.  But this movie isn't really for those people, it's for the kids.  Like many childrens films these days there are jokes and references that only the older audience will appreciate, but overall the film is for you little ones.  And they love it.  I saw Carvey do an interview around the time of the release and he said he wanted to do a movie for his kids.  He felt that all of the stuff he had done in the past he really didn't want kids to see, until they were older. My nephews and all of their friends love Master of Disguise and watch it all the time.  Their constant impressions of the turtle guy and the slapping dummy midget get annoying sometimes, but they enjoy it.  While it is a kid flick, there are plenty of jokes that adults will enjoy, as this is a film that highlights his ability to do impressions.  Impressions of Pacino in Scarface, Quint the guy from Jaws, Bob Ross, George W. Bush, and others are very funny.  I see it as a kid flick I can watch with kids and actually be entertained a bit.

This movie seems like it is made up of skits edited together.  Dana Carvey does a lot of impressions of different characters.  I liked him as the turtle and impression of Robert Shaw from Jaws.  It is funny, but the movie really has no plot.  But it is made just to make us laugh and I think it accomplishes that at times.We get several cameos from Bo Derek, Michael Johnson, and Jessica Simpson. Pistachio's dad is forced to disguise himself as these people to steal priceless items for the evil guy.  It is just so silly that it is funny. But the fart joke with the evil guy was just too annoying because it was done too much.FINAL VERDICT:  I liked it; it made me laugh. It certainly won't stimulate any brain cells, but at least it is entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Could Have Been So Much Better
reviews.content: 9 March 2003. The most entertaining part of this movie was the ending credits - not that the credits were bad, they actually were funny, with out-takes and probably one of the longest lingering ending to a movie ever. Dana Carvey really missed an opportunity to write and make a breakout comedy here. Unfortunately, the talent of Mr. Carvey is wasted because of too many silly jokes, discongruent scenes, and a pretty flat comedy movie. There are brushes with attempts at great comedy here, but they are not enough to save this movie. If only somebody had been really serious enough to spend more time with the script and make it into a focussed, thematic, serious comedy attempt, then this movie might have done a lot better. Dana tries some new stuff, but experimental comedy is one thing, but using a feature movie to try it out is another. I made it through the entire movie, including the end of the credits which must mean something, but the movie wasn't as funny as it could have been and some of the characters played by Dana just weren't interesting or enjoyable. This was a kid's movie that tried to be too grown up about it and failed. Five out of ten stars

OH MY GOD, this movie was a piece of crap. It made no sense and was completely stupid and pointless. I like Dana Carvey from Waynes World but I hated this movie so much cause it sucked more than brussel sprouts and It was way stupider than any movie I ever saw in the whole wide world. Damn it I can not bare this gay movie because it was so dumb, stupid, gay, weird, and disturbing in every singel way. All the bad words describe this stupid movie. Did I mention that this movie was so stupid? Yup I did. No wonder, it is. Who ever liked this movie is weird in all ways. If you did u are very, very, very, very, very constipated.

reviews.review_title: Oh boy this film makes Mission impossible bad
reviews.content: Edited 15/05/2021I decided to rewatch it again today as an adult as I haven't seen this film in a long time.The film is about a shy Italian waiter called Pistachio Disguisy(yup that's his name) played by Dana Carvey who learns that his father and his grandfather are masters of disguises where they don disguises and imitates different accents. However when his father Fabrino(James Brolin)gets kidnapped by a ruthless criminal Bowman(Brett Spliner) who uses Fabrino to steal stuff for him such as the liberty bell and the constitution by posing as famous people from Jesse Ventura to even Jessica Simpson and Bo Derek(who we see in the beginning of the film)it's up to Pistachio to team up with his grandfather(the late Harold Gould) who trains him to become the best master of disguise ever to save his father. So Pistachio and his grandfather find an assistant for him who turns out to be a single mother named Jennifer (played by Jennifer Esposito) who Pistachio starts to like. Will Pistachio save his father from Bowman. Overall it's a silly film that shouldn't be taken seriously. It's so bad it only got 1% on Rotten Tomatoes Tomatoes was dubbed the worst comedy of all time. Dana Carvey is very irritating in this film as he puts on this annoying Italian accent throughout the film and donning silly disguises from an Indian to an elderly woman to even a suavy ladies man. Even the special effects were so bad as for instance we see the famous celebs and then we see this weird skinsuit reveal.Is it as bad as say Son Of The Mask ...well it's up there with that film as that was so bad too.2/10.F.

What did happen to the American comedy movies?! Why this insistence on making comedy through farts?! It's not funny at all!Well, at one week, I had the pleasure of watching 3 American comedies: Problem Child (1989), Larry The Cable Guy: Health Inspector (2006) and this piece of fart, sorry art. And if you were in my shoes, you have to ask yourself the same question: WHY?!Did the international taste become that desperately in love with the dirtiest limit of toilet humor? Then what a nasty world we're living in, to transform its people into ugly suppressed monsters, who love those disgusting bad movies, and ask for more! Or is it the production companies? As they used to present any hasty comedy, as long as it had the huge amount of farts, vomit, and overall bad tasting?, or is it some bankrupt dull artists, who just want to make any possible nonsense to gain money and fame?!!ANYHOW, it's sick. And here you'll be both disgusted and sad, since it had a good potential indeed with nice new plot, a comedian who's determined to be a big star, the powers of make-up, and the opportunity to create a different parody out of famous cinematic characters. But the final result was truly unbearable!I guess that there wasn't much of actual script in this. There was nothing but improvisations. However, very stupid and unfunny improvisations. You'd feel the rashness in everything, otherwise why the police ordered (Pistachio) not to call them again?! Why the grandfather came while nobody called him? How the grandfather came in the bubble?? How all the thefts were done so easily because all the guards all over America deliver all its treasures to famous people just because they're famous people??!! How the lead managed to be that James Bond at the end, to beat 20 strong men?! Not to mention: How to disguise as animal's manure?? How to create a whole character just to fart all along? In fact, it's much simpler than making something novel, distinct, and less sickening!As for the acting, the crime is much bigger. I've never seen (James Brolin) in worse movie, and I kept asking myself how he could bear all of this? (Brent Spiner) is a wonderful comedian, not a machine to manufacture farts. And (Dana Carvey) here is quiet awful to an extent that you won't believe it until you watch it. He intolerably overacted, being dead set on destroying himself with all that detestable continuous Italian accent, lengthy jokes and inept physical performance. That wasn't laughable inasmuch as horrible. Sometimes he was over any standing's possibility, to turn eventually into the master of silliness. The only watchable thing he did was the impersonation parts, especially (Robert Shaw)'s one. However with another treatment, that could have been so enjoyable in a complete movie, because what we have already seen was a complete pain!It's obvious that the best thing in this movie was the creative cartoon of the opening credits. It was the sole thing that was done with intelligent talent. And as for the worst thing, it's - of course - the sequence of the turtle man. OH MY GOD, it was disturbing and ambiguous, and maybe disturbing because of being ambiguous! The only explanation I see for that crime of a character was that they wanted to insert an impersonation of (Kermit the Frog) of The Muppet Show anyway, so they put it in a human form, and maybe not owning the copyrights led to not giving it a name. At any rate, it was totally abominable, especially when he eats someone's nose then puts it back in its place!Just who would hate himself more: (Carvey) for making a movie that nearly ended his cinematic career after promising ones like Opportunity Knocks (1990), and Clean Slate (1994)? Or ourselves to watch this kind of farts many many times those days? After reading some reviews, where I found how this movie being so loved (the turtle man part in particular!), I felt that this comedy could make you doleful, not because of witnessing bad movie that could have been better, but also for witnessing how people began to love ugliness, filth, and low level, passionately... And they made a DVD of it with the director's commentary?! Now here's finally something funny about this movie!

This was one of the worst movies I have ever seen.  Although I am a big Dana Carvey fan, I could not stand this film at all.  It was very, very poorly written.  The plot was horrible and there were many times in the film that I actually couldn't believe what I was seeing it was so bad.  It seemed to me that the final script should have been rough 1st draft at best.  I don't suggest seeing this film at all, its not funny and there isn't a good story at all.

reviews.review_title: A sometimes lame kid's movie, yes. But one of the worst films ever? Never...!
reviews.content: I consider myself a film buff, I write professionally, although only on rare occasions do film reviews, so I feel I have a few more credentials than your average armchair IMDB critic.  All that said, I have never seen such intensely horrible IMDB reviews (e.g. `the worst ever') for a movie that actually wasn't that bad.  Its no great work of art, but I actually enjoyed watching it through adolescent eyes.  It's was intended as a kid's movie for Christ's sake!  Its supposed to be stupid with goofy repetitive gags and lame humor.  But done with a good wink and a nod, if anybody was watching. People saw Dana Carvey's name on the label, thought it was going to be the next Wayne's World or whatever, and were disappointed when it wasn't.  But Dana's charm is there in spades, I loved all the characters he created in this senseless little movie, and the story actually wasn't much lamer or thin than Wayne's World's 1 or 2  if you want to complain about plot within comedy skit-driven movies.Its also pretty obvious from the brevity of the film (only 65 minutes of movie), and the fact that a heap of scenes in the 15 minutes of end-credit outtakes are not in the film, that this flick is an abbreviated version of what Carvey and director Blake originally intended.  Who knows what were the reasons, but I'll bet even money that some cost overrun, studio intervention or other problem resulted in at least a third of this film winding-up on the cutting room floor.  Before watching this movie, just put yourself in the same mind frame as `Spy Kids', but without all the big budget special effects, gadgets and elaborate sets, and you'll probably have a much better chance of enjoying what you see.  I can see why some folks might only give this movie a 4 or 5 (out of 10), but one of the worst films ever?  Never!

reviews.review_title: If you don't get the jokes in this movie...check your
reviews.content: hearing aid and glasses, because it's served to you on a silver platter, with neon lights and showgirls in gold paint repeatedly singing the joke to you.  This is a movie for those who really don't pay that much attention to movies, they might like the jokes, however...it gets really monotonous after a few short minutes.  I thought that only one part was good, and that was after the hairy guy.  You'll know what I mean when you see it.  The rest was boring and stupid.  As for jokes being over your head...I suppose you are mentally very short.  I wouldn't waste my money unless I brought small children...then I would be able to give just the right ammount of attention to the movie to actually enjoy it.Olivia

reviews.review_title: Why is it in the Bottom 100?
reviews.content: I actually came on this page of IMDb to see how HIGH the score was. I thought it would be in the 7's. How wrong I was! But does it really deserve such a low score? The answer is no in my opinion. This was a freaking hilarious movie and Dana Carvey did a really great job in his role. Sometimes it was a little goofy but that's Dana Carvey's style. I don't know why people hated it. I happen to love it and I think a lot of the little ones will enjoy it as well.So if your looking for a funny movie with cute humor I think you'll enjoy it. I mean, I did. Ignore all the other comments because they obviously don't know what they're talking about. I think they had it confused with "The Notebook".

_Master_of_Disguise_ is a niche market movie made and designed by Saturday Night Live folks of today or recent yesteryear. It stars Dana Carvey and also has SNL Adam Sandler in it and he produced it. But, the movie under credits the other stars of the film and fails to mention in its ads the cameos in it that might bring in other niche audiences other than the SNL audience. Brent Spiner plays the villain, Devlin Bowman, and this is one of his bigger non-Star Trek roles.  He seemed to be having a lot of fun in the movie. He gives the character the relish and the glee he gives Lore and some other characters he has also played in the past, but in some ways, it is a new character, but I do see some common denominators between this character and one or more characters he has played in the past.  The other actors and people in the film who were playing themselves, seemed to be having some fun with it also. It is good to watch a movie where one or more actors/actresses really seems to be enjoying what they're doing.  That often seems to be the case with Mr. Spiner. He never leaves his heart behind, but always includes it in any given role. That's one thing that makes Mr. Spiner different from a lot of other actors - he acts with his heart and not just with his head. One catch in the movie is the Cigar Club Turtles which Mr. Carvey has some fun jokes on and Mr. Spiner's character smokes its cigars. But, there really is a Turtle Club out there. It is a secret society. I hear that Johnny Cash is a Turtle. An ex-boyfriend of mine is a Turtle. I may count as a Turtle, too, because I know the secret answer to the secret question.  Anyrate, I laughed all of the way through and saw it 2 extra times for good measure and I don't normally watch SNL because I'm bizzy watching BritComs a lot on Saturday Nights on our local PBS station. But, this was indeed a very funny movie.  Go see it, if you haven't.  Niche markets that might enjoy the film are: SNL audience, Star Trek audience, other actors/actresses/personalities' fans such as Jesse Ventura, Turtles, Alpha Phi Omega National Service Fraternity (most APOs are usually Turtles also), and ages 10-mid-twenties or whenever most people outgrow bathroom humor. But, older people may enjoy it also. The movie has the added flavor of most of the actors/actresses having had stage experience. There is always a different feel to T.V. and movie stuff when the actors are people who are used to performing live, on stage for some reason. Maybe it is the over-the-top feel which more recent Star Trek series tend to be lacking on.  It is your basic silly movie that I've heard Patrick Stewart say is, "America's gift to the world." (our silliness)

I expected THE MASTER OF DISGUISE to be a very hilarious movie where Dana Carvey would be able to showcase his mimicry skills and finally get the recognition he deserves, but unfortunately, the movie is awful. I watched it with a few friends and they all said it was the worst movie they have ever seen. Most of the jokes fall flat, or are dragged out so much that they are no longer funny. It is a very campy and childish movie about a man named Devlin Bowman who kidnaps Pistacio Disguisey's father so he will be able to steal world treasures. To save his father, Pistacio must learn how to become a "master of disguise" with help from his grandfather and his sidekick, the Jennifer Esposito. Antics ensue. Pistacio's Italian accent gets very annoying, just like this entire movie. Dana Carvey is an incredibly talented man who deserves better.

reviews.review_title: Couldn't get far with this movie. That's how bad it it.
reviews.content: What else left is there to say about this abomination? It's terrible! I remember the trailer for this as a kid and thought it looked funny. Boy was I sadly mistaken. When I finally sat down and watched it years later I was disappointed. I couldn't finish it at all. Nothing about it is funny. The characters are bland, the jokes aren't funny at all, and while the story could be interesting it just falls flat on its face like the kid earlier in the movie who the main character (Dana Carvey) tries to cheer up with impersonations. Speaking of which the main character's name is Pistachio Disguisey and he's a doof. I have nothing against Carvey but needless to say his talent was wasted in this movie.The story is him trying to save his family from the main antagonist Devon Bowman (Brent Spiner) with the help of his Grandfather (Harold Gould). His grandfather teaches him disguises he can use which you'd think would be funny but again they fall flat. Stay away from this movie as much as possible. It's god awful. If you can sit through this hats off to you.

Dana Carvey is talented, that's a given.  But he cannot seem to get a really decent cinematic vehicle to display this talent - he had his best chance in The Road to Wellville, where he got to create an actual 3-dimensional character.  In Master of Disguise, he plays the ridiculously-named Pistachio Disguisey (the name alone should give you some idea of how lame this film is).  He talks with a silly yet endearing Italian accent, and he puts on lots of disguises in his quest to save his parents, who have been kidnapped by a bad and rotten evil-doer who wants his father to use his disguise mastery to do bad and rotten evil things, blah blah blah.  What else do you need to know?  Get some popcorn and make the best of it.  It's still Dana Carvey in that turtle suit, after all.

reviews.review_title: just another review of this lousy flat waste of time
reviews.content: I didn't expect much from this movie - based on the reviews and what I got was even less than I expected.As like most of the other stuff that Adam Sandler has his hands on, or any connection with whatsoever - this is dismal, shoddy and embarrassing on all levels - and almost no coherent redeeming value.Do yourself a favour and avoid this one as well. It's a failure from the first 2 minutes - because there is no plot, the characters are poorly created, the casting is totally off and there is little if anything else to keep you amused or entertained.Like most of the other reviewers of this movie, I too will warn you - and it's your responsibility if you don't take it.This is beyond a waste of time.

This might of been the worst movie i've ever seen in my life. The 3.3 rating is generous. It was so bad that it was funny but still hard to watch. The movie was just a bunch of grownups playing dress up.

reviews.review_title: My nine-year-old loved it; what else do you want!
reviews.content: This is not "A Beautiful Mind" but with Carvey who would think it is. My nine-year-old grandson laughed almost uncontrolably all through the movie. I enjoyed that very much! Enjoyed the movie moderately. It's an on-target market for its intended audience and a lot of fun. Expectations are everything. I give it a 6.

"The Master of Disguise" is the latest movie to star Dan Carvey.  In it, he takes on the role of Pistachio Disguisey, a human chameleon who takes on many roles.  I found "Master of Disguise" silly, but somewhat enjoyable. Some of the movie references were well done, but on the whole, most adults would not care for this movie.  Dana Carvey is a talented person, but he really deserved better than this!

Than sitting through this again. Does it make sense to parody other comedies? I mean think about it, to me that's just real laziness. That's what literally every scene in this movie is, a takeoff on other famous and not so famous recent history comedy bits. I'm sure they thought they were geniuses when they came up with this as an idea, but there's a reason it hasn't been done before. Incredible, Carvey as a talent got publicly steamrolled on SNL when Mike Myers joined the cast, and you just can't stop thinking about that watching this. But I'm sure he's a very nice person. By the way, anyone else besides me notice the irony that the list of the all time worst movies...represents a now playing schedule of the premium cable channels like HBO and Cinemax! Help!!!!

This has to be Dana Carvey's best work since Wayne's World. My brother and I have just seen it and we were cracking up at every turn. Each of his disguises(especially the Turtle, Terry Suave and Quinn from Jaws) For those of you who listened to the other reviews, here the truth: (Spoilers Ahead) Dana Carvey plays Pistachio, the son of a restaurant owner. What He doesn't know, is that his father is a Master of Disguise. One day, an old enemy that his father p****d off kidnaps his parents, Pistachio must try to save them. His Grandfather arrives and teaches him his heritage as a Master of Disguise, and teams him with an assistant named Jennifer. The two track down the villain, while Pistachio uses a variety of disguises to save the day. So take it from someone that's seen a lot of comedies. If you like movies like Wayne's World, you'll love this movie

reviews.review_title: Funny scenes to the movie, but overall stupid!
reviews.content: This movie was on cable the other morning and I found nothing better to watch, so I sat down and found myself watching a movie that had some funny scenes, but an overall stupid plot.Carvey is a waiter whose father (Brolin) has an alter ego.  When his parents are kidnapped, his grandfather (Gould) shows up and shows him the reason why he is the way he is: Carvey is a master of disguise...he just doesn't know it yet.With training from his grandfather (like some old karate movie) Carvey sees the light and becomes the formidable opponent to Spiner, who has blackmailed Carvey's father into stealing precious American historical item like the Declaration of Independence and the Liberty Bell (with cameos like Jesse Ventura and Jessica Simpson).Like I said, some of the scenes did make me laugh, but the plot is not very bright...I thought my 12 year old daughter could have written a better plot. Out of 10 stars, it doesn't even make average: I gave it a 4, but only on Carvey, not the rest of the film.

I've seen worse comedy films. At least there wasn't all that sexual humor in it like Dumb and Dumber To. I personally was offended though by his fake Italian accent. My grandfather is full blooded and his accent doesn't sound as stupid as all the actors in this film. I swear Hollywood likes insulting Italians by having only one person that's actually an Italian in it. Let's see in this film only Jennifer Esposito is but everybody isn't. WTF Seriously and in Everybody loves Raymond the only one that actually is, is Ray Romano everybody else forget about. The thing that made this film most notable was how it was so random yet in a way hilarious. I admit most of the impersonations sucked but that's the writers fault for not thinking of better impersonations. Overall it's not the worst but I bet whoever gave this a 1 gave Pulp fiction a 10. Yet Pulp fiction is the worst film I've ever seen. This is a fun little comedy film, 6 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Master of Crap is more like it
reviews.content: A truely horrible movie.  I don't care if it's meant for kids, even eight year old boys should be able to watch this and say, "that was the worst movie i have ever seen."  It's sensless, plotless, and just generally stupid.  Full of crude humor (which isn't even funny) and bad acting, this (along with "the tuxedo") is one movie which doesn't deserve to be called that, a movie.

It was obvious that a lot of work went into the makeup and costumes for this movie but somewhere it went wrong. I had no idea it was for children until after seeing it but it wasn't even great for them. It had a lot of actors that I usually enjoy but somehow, there was no enjoyment today. I hope Dana Carvey doesn't give up after this flop. I won't even rent this one let alone buy it. Hope they don't make too many copies for distribution.

reviews.review_title: On a scale from 1-10, even 1 is too high!
reviews.content: This movie is the worth pile of (insert the worst word you can think of). It is a direct insult to anyone who paid to see it, and even freeloaders will regret this.I used to love Dana Carvey when he did Saturday Night Live, and this was my main motivation to see this film, but this seems to be the end of the man - if there is any fairness in the world. I feel directly hurt watching him insult me and other viewers with this Jim Carrey wannabe-crap (remark, I have no problem with Carrey, only the wannabe's!). This man had his own style but he sold out in the very worst way.There is no point in this film, it's not funny, it's sad. All attempts fall to the ground and this movie should never have been!!!On a scale from 1 to 10, 1 (which is awful) is still WAY too over rated! THIS IS, in short, THE SORT OF GARBAGE THAT ORDINARY GARBAGE WOULD FROWN UPON!Sorry, Carvey! VERY sorry!

reviews.review_title: Come on, guys, it's a kid movie, not 007!!!
reviews.content: I am disappointed in everyone who voted negatively against thismovie.  I hadn't seen it in the theater, but saw Dana Carvey on TheView talking about it, so I rented it.  He said he wrote it for 8 yearold kids!  Come on, guys, it's AWESOME for that age group.  In fact,my 4 year old and 7 year old LOVED it!  They watched it 7 times in5 days!  (Please don't take offense at this, I don't usually let themwatch that much TV, but they really loved it.  I probably won't buy itfor that very reason!)  My 4 year old son still quotes Pistachio all thetime and just laughs and laughs!  He keeps asking, "Mom,remember that part in "Masters of the Sky"?"  So, all you peoplewho are dissing this movie, just stop it!  Go analyze dramas andthrillers and leave the great people who are making good kidmovies alone!

This is a film for kids only.  Granted, some of Carvey's disguises are funny, but not enough funny enough to save this bomb.  Carvey, James Brolin and Harold Gould all speak with the worst Italian accents imaginable.  Even Brent Spiner is bad as the villain.  Diehard Carvey fans are likely to be disappointed by this one.

reviews.review_title: A career killer disguised as an unfunny comedy.
reviews.content: Dana Carvey is a talented comedian that has previously worked on a lot of funny shows and movies like "Wayne's world" and "Saturday Night Live". However, all this comedic talent seems to have faded away while he was writing and starring in this particular movie based on the "Saturday Night Live" sketch of the same name. Sadly, what works as a five minute sketch does not work as an eighty minute long movie. The movie is unfunny beyond belief, but it can be entertaining in a guilty pleasure kind of way as long as you turn your brain off before you start watching.

reviews.review_title: An inept waiter finds he has inherited the role of "Master of Disguise" and must fight evil and injustice.
reviews.content: I rate this extremely silly movie highly because my kids (ages 6 and 9) loved it. It also contains fairly harmless fun featuring some slapstick slapping and a recurring fart joke. There is no cursing.I like Dana Carvey, but had trouble enjoying this film during my initial viewing as I kept trying to make sense of the absurd plot. During subsequent viewings (Those with kids know what I mean), I gave up on that, and I too found myself looking forward to each ridiculous Carvey incarnation.Some of the characterizations are classic Carvey that have been shoehorned into the plot (Al Pacino's Scarface as a disco dancer, Robert Shaw from Jaws), while others are just over the top silly (Turtleman!). But like I said, kids love it. It's the sort of innocent fun that allows you to leave the room guilt free if you don't like Dana Carvey.

Even if I had a frontal lobotomy, I couldn't sit through this piece of cow dung.  It's basically a series of unfunny Dana Carvey skits, with a "written in ten minutes" screenplay to (sort of) tie them together.  Awful. Dreadful.Dana Carvey should be REALLY embarrassed by this. How did it ever get released?

reviews.review_title: Stupid goof ball film that shows how low Dana Carvey has sunk
reviews.content: After great movies like Wayne's World and it's sequel, I was happy to watch Master of Disguise to see how Dana could show off more of his acting talents. Oh my gosh! This film is too childish and stupid for adults and no kids under five would like this film. To many baby scenes like with Dana falling onto his grand papa inside a fat suit that has blown up over it's usual weight. The disguises are all unique but some are too stupid, like take the German with the big teeth! Dana is not funny at all with his stupid impressions and his goofy jokes that are not funny at all. A few scenes are good like the Mr. Peru scene, I liked that which is a homage to Scarface's Tony Montana. But the villain is too predictable and he has a stupid farting problem, his henchmen are to dull, and the whole idea of coloring the movie to match it's main actor for purpose was just too idiotic. Can you kill ninjas by slapping them, can Jesse Ventura steal the liberty bell, are there masters of disguises? NO! This film is pure rubbish, skip this film. You will be happy without it. Bad Dana Carvey, bad!

My 8 year old and I received passes to see a preview of this movie.   I like Dana Carvey, I really do but oh this movie is a stinker.   My daughter laughed but then again she is 8 and jokes about farting (of which there are many) are just so darn funny to her.   The story was flat, the acting poor. The only funny parts to me, were Carvey's disguise as the Pacino character from Scarface (which looked just like him) and his disguise as the Robert Shaw character from Jaws.  Of course most of the kids had NO IDEA who they were but the adults laughed. Final comment....I'm glad I didn't have to pay to see this movie.

My daughter who is 5 loved the commercial for this movie. "Turtle turtle!" It was a catch phrase of hers for ahile. This came out on Pay Per View and always having liked Dana Carvey I thought this might be one of those films that parents and children could both enjoy. WRONG!  Its just BAD! Even the "Turtle turtle" part was BAD! It was just an unfunny mess. It didnt work on ANY level. My daughter fell asleep about 25 minutes in. When the turtle part came on I thought about waking her,but didnt. Why bother?

reviews.review_title: funny, dont believe the bone heads
reviews.content: I think it's funny that people here that are knocking this film, would probably laugh at dopey movies like Jim Carrey does. Stuff Karl Childers (sling blade) would enjoy watching saturday morning cartoons. It's not stupid comedy. I think the ones who dislike this one expect dumb slapstick comedy rather than the kind that Carvey delivers here. I rated it a 6. Not the best I've seen but certainly does not deserve the insulting 1 votes here. Give it a try and don't believe the bone heads.

reviews.review_title: Master of comedic talent, failure at screenwriting
reviews.content: I went out and saw this movie right away because I knew that Dana Carvey had a real talent for impressions, that almost everything he did on Saturday Night Live was hillarious, and that I saw a lot of the same comedic talent in the movie's ads in the past couple weeks.  The previous review here further cemented my decision to see this movie immediately.  What I found, however, left me irritated and empty.In short, the only funny parts of the movie were during Dana Carvey's caricatures.  The rest of the movie was a sorry attempt at screenwriting. First off, I didn't realize beforehand that this movie could've been rated "G" except for one "nuts and weiners" joke;  thus, most of the humor in the screenwriting was more akin to 8-year-olds than fairly mature adults.  But, keeping this in mind, there was still a chance this movie could've been pulled off.  However, the cliche-filled plot wasn't even worth following because it had so many holes in it, it was more akin to a collander. Combine that with only passable acting and very shallow character development (especially in the lead woman character, who had a lot of potential that wasn't realized), and what you have is a movie that is utterly pointless.And this is a real, real shame considering Dana Carvey's obvious comedic talent.  Honestly, the funniest part of the movie was the credits, with all the outtakes and characters that never made it into the movie.  If you're a real Dana Carvey fan, get it on video and fast-forward to his impression-bits and the credits.  Otherwise, see something else.

reviews.review_title: Not Perfect but consider it for what it is.
reviews.content: Great family movie. A bit slow at points when you're older but it has enough funny moments to keep your interest.Lot of Scrooge types reviewing this. I'd like to see them make a comedy. ;)

...and it wasn't a chick flick. This movie is bad on so many levels. Dana Carvey, in all seriousness, what the f#$% were you thinking?!? Who authorized this piece of crap? The plot...don't even get me started. This is, bar none, the single WORST comedy movie I have ever seen. The acting...oh God, it hurts so bad. And then there's the bloopers.Rating: -10 out of 10Bottom line: Go watch Carvey's "Chooping Broccoli" sketch from SNL. You'll get more laughter out of those 3 minutes than you'll get out of this horrible turd.

You can tell he made this for his kids, and it's a great movie for the family.  The kids were laughing at the silly bits, we parents were laughing at the almost, but not quite, naughty bits, and everybody giggled throughout.  Short enough so the kiddies don't lose interest, long enough to tell the story (which is really rather sweet), and the extra scenes during the credits are worth the price of admission by themselves.  Fun for all!

I watched it with a 9 yo.  I had thought one of us would laugh @ some point with Dana Carvey writing and staring in it.  I was wrong.  Movies that are this expensive to make are almost painful to me.Things I liked: Jennifer Esposito has some screen presence - The little ball and the font in the opening credits - Scareface dance sequenceThings I had difficulty with: Brent Spiner can't do fart jokes to save his life - All the impersonations were just off - Pacing of the action - Accents.

Being a big-time Dana Carvey fan, this movie was such a disappointment. This movie does even more damage to Dana's poor track record of movies.We all know Dana's strengths as a comedian.  He is a great person at performing different characters and impersonations.  So one would think that `The Master of Disguise' is a perfect forum for Dana to showcase his talents.  So what could go wrong?Let me start.  Most have called this a kid's movie.  But is it?  I think others mistake a movie that is SO STUPID that it must be a kids movie. Let's just say it was a kid's movie.  Which I doubt but let's assume that Dana would make the first kids movie he has ever made and let's assume Happy Madison productions decides after about 20 or so movies to make a kids movie.  Why the heck is Dana Carvey targeting kids?????  Do any kids even know who he is?  Do any kids want to go see a kids movie by a guy who was on Saturday Night Live in the 80's?Anyways, here is my opinion of why this movie was terrible.  First of all the main character was a total:  imbecile, moron, dufus, man-child, etc. This Character made Pee Wee Herman seem like James Bond.  The character was so idiotic that it wasn't funny.  It was ok for about 5 minutes but he was that way the whole movie.  He was so dorky that I don't believe anyone in the movie theater hoped he would get the hot girl.   Of course he did.Even his disguising wasn't funny.  Let me give a few details on the Turtle Man.  Here's all there was to that gang.  Pistachio (Carvey) found a clue that the bad guy would be at the Turtle Club.  So he thinks the best way to get in is to dress like a turtle.   When he gets in the club do you think he does anything clever?  Of course not  his character is a moron.  Besides standing out like a sore thumb in a high class club dressed like a turtle all this moron does do is say `Turtle' over and over again.  That is it. Oh, yes he lifts his head in and out of the shell a few times.  Picture this a guy in a turtle costume in a high class club lift his head in and out of the shell and saying:  `Turtle.Turtle..Turtle..Turtle.Turtle.' etc. Is that funny?  Sounds like reject material for another Happy Madison movie called the Animal.This is what I think Dana should of done to correct the script.  Do more impersonations, less of the `turtle guy' humor (which is all you get).  He had two somewhat humorous Dana Carvey type parts.  One with Dana as George W Bush and another of Carvey playing the Robert Shaw character from Jaws. But even there it could have been funnier.  But back to my recommendations: More impersonations (not two).  And MOST of all the main character should have been played more straight.  Maybe even like his characters from his other movies:  Clean Slate or Opportunity Knocks.If  you must see a Dana Carvey movie see the Waynes World movies or even Clean Slate and Opportunity Knocks were better.  Take if from a fan of Dana's from the SNL days this movie was SO DISAPPOINTING.

This movie is terrible. The only semi-funny bits are juvenile fart jokes (which they repeat throughout the movie as a running gag). I've seen serious drama that was funnier than this movie. Even Greek tragedy is funnier than this movie. Basically, this movie is supposed to be funny, but instead it's cringe worthy. The raison d'être of this movie is that Dana Carvey is good at impersonating people, so that's what he does throughout the movie - but it just isn't funny at all. Yes, there is a really stupid throwaway story about a lineage of "masters of disguise", but that's just a setup for Dana's impersonations. And they're not funny. He does an impersonation of Scarface which people seem to like, but even that one is overacted - which is kind of impressive when you consider how Al Pacino did chew the scenery in the original movie. Dana Carvey just CANNOT ACT, and he doesn't even try. He can make stupid "mime" style faces, that's all. I cannot imagine who their target audience was? This is way too juvenile for the Wayne's World crowd, but this wasn't presented as a children's movie, but rather a Dana Carvey vehicle?The producers of this must be blamed. What were they thinking?Avoid this movie at all cost - you have been warned!

reviews.review_title: Remember when Dana Carvey was funny?
reviews.content: This is sad.  So sad.  What happens when talented people lose their way?  Even Dana doesn't seem to believe in this material. This pathetic attempt at humor is one giant "Ouch, babe!" Quite possibly the worst piece of film since we turned the calendar on 2000.

reviews.review_title: A True Chore to Sit Through
reviews.content: There are few great films, some good ones, a lot of mediocre ones, and then bad movies. Some of the bad ones have redeeming qualities; they're dumb, but fun, (Armageddon), or have a really cool premise that just missed the mark, (Southland Tales), or are just so silly and ridiculous they become cult classics, (Kung Pow). 'Master of Disguise' is none of those, and is not even bad - it's god awful. A film so bad it deserves it's own classification. On the level of films like 'Cats' or 'Showgirls', it's a film so bad it's a wonder how it was even green-lit in the first place. At a glacial 80 minutes, (including the beginning and end credits), it feels like 8 hours.Starting with a weak premise, (a 'Master of Disguise', whatever that is), that's merely an excuse to get Dana Carvey to do impressions - the audience gets to experience Carvey's nonsensical training which includes; dressing up in brown-face and doing racist accents, objectifying women, (they literally ask a woman her measurements and them mock her for having a small backside), acting like a creep to kids, and an avalanche of other despicable, unfunny moments. The supporting cast, including Spiner, Brolin and Esposito all give it their best - but when a recurring fart joke is the funniest thing in your movie - you've got major problems.Although I've never liked his comedy or skits, Carvey seems like a nice person, and is hilarious in interviews, (his series of interviews on the 'Conan Needs a Friend' podcast are a riot). Maybe Carvey should just stay in the writers room; when he's on screen, it's an absolute disaster.
You know how sometimes SNL would have skits that are awkward and not funny, this film is one of them and it's 81 minutes too long. This movie is freaking awful!!! The Turtle scene!!? WTF!!!

This is half an idea jammed awkwardly into 2/3 of a film. It only runs 68 minutes, and runs out of steam long before that. I laughed slightly only twice, and that was during the 16 minute end credits filled with bloopers. Other than that and Miss Rodriguez, this is a waste of time. Lame jokes are half set up and then delivered almost as an after thought. Dana Carvey just doesn't have the star power to carry even a supporting role. It's a good thing he's backed up by such superstars as James Brolin and Bo Derek. It's about as funny as getting poked in the eye. As memorable as a toothache. Less interesting than your last attack of diarrhea. Still, I'd have to say I was more entertained than I was by Attack of the Clowns, not that that's such a hard thing to accomplish. RATING: 3 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the Worst Big Studio Comedy Ever
reviews.content:
I have just returned from taking my seven year old to see this movie, and I am still numb from the experience.  The only thing worth saying about this pile of dreck is that it is the embodiment of everything that is wrong with big studio comedies today times two hundred.  After five minutes, I was stunned at how poorly paced, acted, written, directed, shot, and even lit this turkey was.  After an hour, I was just sad.  My mind started wandering to all the other things that could have been done with the money and effort wasted on this complete travesty. 
To excuse the inanity of this movie by saying it's a kid's film is an insult to the intelligence and wit of children everywhere.  To downplay the utter creative failure this movie represents by noting that it turned a profit is too cynical to fathom.  This is, quite simply, one of the worst movies ever made.  Period.  Dana Carvey, Adam Sandler, I want you to give me back the ninety minutes of my life I wasted watching your movie.

reviews.review_title: If you hate Dana Carvey, you'll love this movie
reviews.content: I never thought I would walk out of a Dana Carvey movie.I anxiously awaited the release of this movie, because I am a Carvey fan. I mourned his departure from SNL, and I like his movies, regardless of their goofiness (Opportunity Knocks, Clean Slate, etc.) because his talent is showcased.  With this fetid piece of tripe (a nod to MST3K, a show on which this movie would probably feel at home), he has nailed shut the coffin of his career.  A cameo appearance by Carrot Top would have lent an air of dignity to the movie, but alas, we are not so blessed.  This "film" will do for his career what murdering your wife and her friend does to a football legend.  I kid you not.I will definitely think twice about seeing another Dana movie, if this is the sort of script that he accepts.To emphasize the crappiness of this movie, I will reiterate that I have walked out on exactly 3 movies in my life, and I sat through Twister and Road Trip.

I rented this movie hoping to get a good laugh. Well, that was a waste of good money. In the movie, Dana Carvey a (hardly) lovable restaurant owner's son. When his parents are kidnapped by a dim-witted criminal mastermind, he learns his father is a master disguise artist. To save his parents, he'll have to become a "master of disguise."There were a few funny scenes. Dana Carvey as Mr. Peru was kinda funny. I especially liked the parts where Dana Carvey is working with his grandpa. And I loved Carvey's "I'm going to be a master of disguise" dance. But the rest of the movie was pointless. Most of Dana Carvey's characters, like Turtle Guy, and that little German nerd, rank among the most annoying characters I have ever seen in any movie. The supporting characters did little redeem Carvey's performance. If you're looking for a movie to rent on Friday nights, avoid this at all costs. P.S.: What the heck was Jessica Simpson doing with the lunar lander?!

i first saw 'master of disguise' when it came out on DVD in early 2003. i remember it being funny, but now i see it as being kind of silly. well, there were some really funny deleted scenes included on the DVD, which (in my opinion) shouldn't have been cut out at all! but really, this movie was pretty unusual for a kid's movie. i mean, a comedian most kids didn't know of at the time, dressing up as some iconic people kids don't know exist, (Quint, Tony Montana)and a scene in which a bumbling idiot and his grandfather disguss the size of a woman's ass? i mean, seriously! is this movie for kids for for sexually frustrated teens? 3/10
Underappreciated, this movie was my childhood, with bunch of main characters that I truly enjoyed. Don't read these bad reviews

Is it the Oscar winner of that year? Hell no! Is it one of the better early 2k's from Happy Madison? Yes, but you gotta be all in for the cast, the deep cut references to the other media... it's hard to explain.Take for example the bad guy, it's Brent Spiner, Data from Star Trek. In this movie as the bad guy, he has a condition where every time he laughs too hard, he farts. It's comical to then be seeing "Data" laughing and farting like some bad meme.Odd references and nerd connection like that are where this movie does hit home, but if you're not into it, YOU'RE DEFINITELY NOT INTO IT! But if you saw the trailer or even just the artwork for this one, and you went in expecting Oscar gold? Well that's on you.The movie is enjoyable and has some groaners and dad jokes as well as deep cut references. Not a 3, but definitely not more than a 5 either.

I knew from the trailers that this movie was a disaster. This is why I did not go see it at a theatre. I watched it on video solely for the purpose of supporting Dana Carvey. Dana was brilliant on SNL. I loved the impressions he pulled off. He is very talented. Unfortunately he made a poor choice with this movie. I agree with others who have asked why Carvey needed to make a kid's movie.Nothing makes sense in this movie. Why does Dana's character have a heavy Italian accent if he was raised in the U.S.A.? None of the characters are likeable. Dana's character seemed to be retarded.The fart jokes were plain stupid. How that got in the final product I do not know. All the actors are known names and people I like but this script and production had them all treading in toilet water.I hope this movie does not end Dana's movie career. I see Dana making a come back as a vibrant character actor. He will not make it as a lead actor. Also it would be great if Dana could come back to TV comedy with the right vehicle.

reviews.review_title: Okay for young kids, boring for adults
reviews.content: My 7 year old laughed a lot, especially at the running fart joke (which I laughed at too, must admit). But there is really little here to interest anyone older than that. Carvey's disguises are great, but that's about all there is to this movie. His character is too silly to believe, there is a kid in a superfluous role, the usual babe for love interest, and a lot of general silliness around a wafer thin plot. It's safe for kids if they really want to see it, best to wait for video and save your money.

I like Dana Carvey, I really do.  In fact, me and my friends were kinda hopin' this movie would do well.  It didn't.  So I saw it.  I'm sorry Dana, but what happened?Amusing characters is one thing, but when the jokes rely on the "funny" way the characters are saying them, there is something terribly wrong.  I always look for the good in movies and when I saw the delectible Jennifer Esposito (if you like her, check out her work in the little-known, decent indie "The Proposal") and multi-talented Brent Spiner, I had hope.  But even they couldn't salvage this movie.A weak plot, stupid characters names, a sheer lack of jokes, and SHAMELESS cameos (they even suckered poor Jennifer Simpson in), all work together to bring this movie down.In closing, yes, Jim Carrey has made a living saying stuff behind funny faces for years... but at least what he's saying is funny.Leaving the ladies smilin',da_flipboy

The Master of Disguise is not the worst movie ever made, but it is very very bad. It is a family/kid's movie so I try not to be really mean because I watched it as an adult. However, there are so many things in this movie that are bad and a lot of them are hard to ignore even then. What is really bad about this movie is it's not "all in" on being a kid's movie nor does it market itself especially well to an adult audience. For instance, jokes about Al Pachino and butt measurements are fine, for adults, but children will not get them. Dana Carvey's lead is almost too simple. For example, he channels the energy needed to impersonate people well by simply chanting, "become another person" or "become someone else", kids will get it, but I think even children would prefer something a little more cryptic and clever. One thing I will say, on the positive is the flatulence gag. As an adult it's not funny but the running gag with the villain laughing himself until flatulence would probably be very funny to a kid. The most confusing thing about this whole movie is the "blooper reel". There are entire sketches in the reel that look as if they put in almost as much effort into as the actual movie, it wasn't very long, why not put them in? I'm serious, this is a short movie that probably has the longest blooper reel in history. In conclusion, this one is painful. However, it's not just boring like "Super Mario Brothers" nor is it a complete waste of time like "Disaster Movie", so I give it a 3.

Ever seen a film that makes you hate life? This one is really close....I'd start off with saying 'spoilers', but the entire film was basically shown in it's trailer. If you saw the trailer, you saw what may have been worth watching. After plopping down my 5 bucks (matinee's are the only way to go these days), I sat down in a nice theatre awaiting a new film by Dana Carvey. I will admit a liking for him, he has made me laugh in the past. I was even willing to look past the fact that he has never shown he can carry a movie, playing smaller parts much better and coming across as less annoying.The movie: The movie follows a...well.....retarded 30 year old named Pistachio Disguisee. He's not supposed to be retarded, but there is no other explanation for him. He comes from a long line of Master of Diguise's, but his Papa (James Brolin)elected to hide this from him in order for a more normal life. But the family way was always with Pistachio as he mocked people from the day he was born. His father owns a restaurant where the whole family works and, apparently, other waiters are allowed to keep their jobs while making a fool of Pistachio. Anyway, a long ago bad guy (Brent Spiner) of his father comes back to town and kidnaps the parents and forces Papa to do his bidding by disguising himself and stealing rare artifacts. He does this by threatening Mama (Edie McClurg), who is kept under a drug induced haze. That's when Yoda... I mean Grandpa comes to town. He's never met his grandpa, so he calls him his sister. HAHAHA!! WOW! Wait the Laughs are just getting started. Everytime you see the bad guy, someone farts and stops the entire screen. FUNNY!. Listen, Grandpa teaches him the art of the Jedi...I mean Disguisee, he hires an assistant, Jennifer Lopez, or someone like that. They both go under cover in all sorts of suits and such to find out who's doing the evil bidding...and.....and....URGGH!!!!! At this point in the theatre, the 6 people have dwindled to 2,  me and my mother, who was begging me to take her back to her group home!! I was tempted to, but, it was my weekend with her and we had to do something to pass the time. The rest of the film is filled with pointless story, bad characters that make you cry and shameless hamming by Carvey. Turtle Man made me frightend for the future. The fact that Pistachio only liked woman who had child bearing hips was the only thing I could relate to. The running fart joke made me laugh, but it was because I was farting along with it. Sadly, I left to use the restroom (chaining mother to her chair), came back and found that the movie wasn't over, and yet, I hadn't missed a thing. I couldn't tell if something important happened or not. The best part of the movie is when the credits are rolling and it says something about what type of film they used and shows the little symbols for the companies. That meant it was over and I could go home. SO the morals of this film are: Accept the fact that you're not a lead actor, never advertise using the bits that may have been funny if not seen before, and always make sure you see these movies with people that can't run away. Amen.

( Please note that this review was not written by me, the actual imbetterthanu, it was written by my little sister.) This was the worst movie I've ever seen. It wasn't funny at all, it was just plain stupid. Whoever made this movie probably smells funny, and they are also very stupid. Now you know how i think of the movie.

reviews.review_title: Mildly amusing but not a must-see on ANY level
reviews.content: I just watched "The Master Of Disguise" last night. Other than being completely and utterly ridiculous, it did give Dana Carvey a chance to do what he does best, dress in silly costumes and talk in funny voices. Otherwise I thought it was a waste of time. There were some funny parts...Brent Spiner's bad guy was amusing, and Jennifer Esposito as Pistachio's sexy right-hand girl. Otherwise it was a waste of an hour and a half. Got kids? They might enjoy it. Otherwise, rent something worthwhile (I recommend "The Banger Sisters") for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Does Not Deserve So Much Hate!
reviews.content: If you were planning on watching this movie, don't listen to these other reviews! I am 14 years old, and I love this movie. Now that I'm a teenager, I criticize almost everything my 9 year old brother watches. But when he showed me this movie, I thought it was hilarious. Dana Carvey is great in all the characters he does, and come on; Happy Madison has done so many movies just like this, you couldn't expect too much from it. Some parts are extremely dumb, but many of the jokes are actually pretty good. In my opinion, this movie is not as good as Wayne's World, but it's up there. Definitely watch this with your kids, and you'll probably enjoy it too!

This over budgeted, juvenile piece of cinematic sewage, makes Such Turkeys as Rhinestone, Citizen kane.  My friend's Five year old looked at me mid way through and even said, can we go home now??  UGGGGGHHHHH!!!  What horrors will the Studios unleash upon us next??

reviews.review_title: Not that bad, BUT DANA CARVEY?
reviews.content: Usually I like to write a very constructive review that analyzes the good and bad of any movie. But I just can't.It's not because this movie was that bad.
