In fact, when I was younger I actually enjoyed it. While it is nothing good, it isn't bad either. In fact, at least it's entertaining for a child.It's just the fact that the protagonist is played by Dana Carvey... I didn't know who he was when I was a kid, but I do now and it hurts seeing him reduced to nothing.It really hurts... It hurts so bad it ruins the film entirely, as well as my mood when I think about it. If you're reading this and don't know who he is, I beg you to check out his SNL work. He is an amazing comedian.Overall, this film is nothing horrendous. It doesn't have much of a message, the comedy can only be enjoyed by small children, and it's quite forgettable. But it's harmless entertainment for children. Adults and teens will want to sit this one out... especially if they know who Dana Carvey is.

I have this movie on DVD.  This is my second attempt at watching it. Its the worst thing I've ever seen.  Its bringing back painfulmemories of Hudson Hawk.  Yes Dana Carvey is talented.  A comedy film needs a good director.  This really is the mess of all messes. It is not, as others have said, a bunch of skits joined together. Aren't skits funny ??  This is a bunch of garbage joined together. I just finished watching Dumb & Dumber'er ... which although not too funny, is definitely 150% better than this.  I'm gonna have to turn it off now. My second time... I made 42 minutes..., 20 ofwhich was writing this and nothing on the screen could take me away from writing this... just gave me more conviction to complete the review.

reviews.review_title: If you were expecting some Blockbuster film, go home....
reviews.content: OK so look, The Master of Disguise was not a great film. But it wasn't awful either. If you're a kid then you'll probably like it. But if your an adult and looking for something to laugh hard at, this isn't the film for you. It's simply a different kind of humor.Spaghetti falling on people's heads, slapstick violence, funny voices, it's all young humor. Just accept it for what it is, it's a family/kids movie. But perhaps someone else besides Dana Carvey would have been suitable for the role of Pistachio. Dana Carvey was more into actual real comedies. Maybe Tom Kenny, someone already associated with kids cartoons and movies.THE MASTER OF DISGUISE (2002)

reviews.review_title: I can'T believe pple spend thousands of dollars for such a crap
reviews.content: When I looked at the box cover I told myself "hey it might be decent.." But, when you watch this you find out you should have gone for a walk instead. Of course, the Turtle Guy part brings a little smile, but I think it's the only thing funny in the movie. There is no structure in this movie, the story unfolds bad, Dana Carvey does his best and what the director tells him and he's not very funny. however , I liked Brent Spiner ( star trek's Data) as a vilain. Even a kindergarten would get bored with this ( should I say crap ) ?

Many people went in to this movie expecting too much, and were obviously disappointed (you can learn a moral from that). If you do this, how could you ever expect a movie to live up to your expectations, doesn't seem fair.This movie was funny in many places, although it was rather slow in the beginning.There are many references adults would even enjoy.  This is not Dana Carvey's best work, but it's not a waste (if you wanna go cheap, see it during a matinee).

reviews.review_title: Jaws scene worth price of admission!!
reviews.content: This was a terrible movie. I saw it to see how bad it would be but it didnt quite become inept enough to be "so bad it's Good". I didnt laugh once(Chuckled at Turtle Man though) until Carvey did this impersonation of Robert Shaw as Quint in Jaws to outsmart some dumb hoods. Laughter erupted out of me I couldn't believe how stupid and funny it was at the same time. Can't believe nobody else commented on this? Most people had probably walked out by this time. they should have stayed. The scene was worth the price of admission.

After I saw Scooby Doo at the theater, I never thought I would again witness a movie that topped it for sheer idiocy, lousy acting, and utter lack of inspiration.  Then I saw Master of Disguise.  The only way I can properly describe the effect it had, is to say it was a Freddy Got Fingered-ish string of retarded skits.  It was like an overly long home video.  I can't dump on this movie enough.  I don't need to, where my dumping leaves off, the movie dumps on itself like a baby ruins diapers.  The script was idiotic.  The character Pistachio is an annoying #$%# that Jar Jar Binks would be jealous of.  This is one of the absolute worst movies of all time. DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE.  DO NOT LET YOUR PET DOG WATCH THIS MOVIE.  This review already is more in-depth than the movie's plot.  Don't waste your time or money with this crud.

Kids absolutely loved it.
Despite my misgivings this one ended up being one of my all time favourite funny family movies.The critics, as usual are completely out of touch of what was special about this movie.I know good movies.This is one, for the young family.

There are good films and there are bad films. The Master of Disguise is a bad film. Period. Dana Carvey stars as Pistachio Disguisey, an Italian waiter who has a strange and uncontrollable addiction to mimicking his customers. When his mother (Eddie McClurg) and father (James Brolin) are kidnapped by a criminal mastermind (Brent Spiner), Pistachio learns with the help of his grandfather (Harold Gould) that he has inherited a magical power that allows him to disguise himself as anyone in the world, which he must use to save his parents.I don't know what Dana Carvey was thinking when he decided to take part in this film. I believe that it was a waste of his great acting abilities and this has probably ruined his career (in fact, according to his IMDb page he hasn't been in anything since this.) My main problem with this film are the childish, unfunny jokes. There just aren't any laugh-out-loud parts of the film that I can remember. For example, there is a running joke in which Spiner's character has uncontrollable flatulence and it fails terribly to gain a laugh.I think that they had a good plot line in their hands, but it got lost in the terrible writing. This could have been a classic, fun family film that both parents and children could enjoy and could have made Dana Carvey very well known and more of a household name. It's a shame that this film was so bad because Dana Carvey has so much talent.The only good thing I can come up with about The Master Of Disguise is that kids will love it. But, I have to say that kids are pretty god damn stupid.With bad jokes and childish humour, The Master Of Disguise is a terrible film. I give it 3/10.

This movie counts on 5 year old children giggling to this broken spring of a film in order to make money. It's easily one of the cringiest movies I've seen in my life. Akward acting, very poor duologue, and script that sounds nearly possessed. Aside form that, the plot moves a bit smoothly at a calm rate, the villan isn't the worst thing I've ever seen, and, if you're alone when you watch it, you can actually laugh to the cringness of it. And at least it doesn't become offensive to the point of a PG13 rating. I watched this movie at a very young age, and I loved it. But at least I'm more responsible for this than I used to. So all in all, it's just plain bad.

reviews.review_title: The New Era of Cult Classics
reviews.content: Master of disguise is perfect for what it is, a low density comedy for kids to enjoy and parents to tolerate. Revered in our time for being a relic, a reminder of a time long passed. MoD will stand the test of time as it already has, held firmly in place by the inner naivety of a lost generation.

How did it only rank #38 on the worst 100 list?  Terrible script, no acting, no plot .... it is difficult to believe it was made at all.  Hopefully nobody counted on getting anything for their points.  Dana Carvey is a one-trick pony ...and the trick isn't all that good!!!!!

Comedy is one of the hardest arm forms to perfect, and, as all great comedians know, the key is timing. Dana Carvey is a funny guy, but unfortunately the director of this half-hearted effort clearly knows nothing of timing. SNL alum Carvey (Wayne's World) plays Pistachio Disguisey, a well-meaning Italian waiter with an annoying tendency toward slap-stick idiocy. Take for example, an early scene where he trips and dumps spaghetti all over the heads of a wealthy family. He then proceeds to grate cheese on them. If you find this description hilarious, this is a good movie for you. The plot, although completely inconsequential, involves Disguisey's revelation that he is a member of the legendary Disguisey family which means that he has the god-given talent to transform himself into anyone or anything he wants. He uses this talent to find his parents, who have been kidnapped by the evil and flatulent Devlin Bowman. To help him out, he joins with sexy partner Jennifer Baker (Jennifer Esposito, doing her best to save this movie) with whom he has some romantic tension, even though, in his opinion, her butt is too small. That's basically the level of intelligence in this movie. Other winning jokes include gags about cow pies, explosive flatulence, and wearing> underwear on one's head. Blatantly quoting lines directly from `Shrek' serves only as a testament to how few new ideas this movie has. Are there no funny moments? To be honest, there are a few. Carvey pulls off a dead-on impersonation of Robert Shaw's character from `Jaws' in one of the few scenes that hits its mark. Jennifer Esposito puts in a charming performance. And, in what is unquestionably the movie's funniest moment, pistachio quotes from Madonna's `Papa Don't Preach.' But will kids appreciate any of the elements I just mentioned? No, of course they won't. and hopefully, they'll be intelligent enough to not appreciate anything else this tired and unfunny movie throws at them. (*/****)

This is a movie that is stupid funny. The characters are funny. The villain and plot is funny and at the very least you'll get a chuckle out of this movie. The whole disguise plot gave us many laughs as Carey transformed into many different people. The humor is more targeted towards kids than adults but it would make a good family movie none the less.

reviews.review_title: Is there a rewind on me buying this movie?
reviews.content: I really, really wanted to like this movie.  I love Dana Carvey (from SNL) and Brent Spiner (from Star Trek: TNG).Unfortunately, there are literally NO laugh out loud moments in this movie. The only chuckles even, were generated when Brent Spiner's character laughed maniacally and then got cut off by his uncontrollable gas. Otherwise, the few smiles just didn't cut it.I bought this, but do yourself a favour and don't even rent it.  Get Wayne's World, or Moving, or some other comedy where Dana Carvey is actually funny.Phew.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as you think
reviews.content: Sure, the trailers showed all the best parts, but that doesn't mean they weren't funny in the movie itself!*Possible spoilers*-(if it matters that much to you)For example, the Turtle Guy was absolutely hilarious, I couldn't stop laughing, even though I've seen it on TV a million times. His Tony Montana was good, but I would've liked to seen more of Gammy Num Nums or that 19th century-like toy guy from the end credits.There's a lot of filler and pointless story, but hey, isn't summer the season for cheap laughs and cheap thrills?

What a horrible movie! Dana Carvey is repulsive, revolting and self-serving. Who in Gods name allowed him to go ahead and produce such utter crap. Not even my partners seven year old brother laughed. Im not even going to bother explaining why - just trust me and avoid at all costs.

Save your time and money-I can't believe Adam Sandler had his name attached to this. My kids didn't even like it. The funniest part of the movie is during the credits. Dana Carvey needs to stay away from writing. Funny guy but not a funny story.

This film got a 1 out of 10... I would give it lower but the box doesn't let me...I was made to sit down and watch this film on a weekend... I could have used the time it was on to do something useful, like feed the homeless or rescue a puppy but NOOOO! I was made to sit through this pile of FILTH! FILTH I TELL YOU! FILTH! Dana Carvey's put on Italian accent is infuriating and the fact that the once mighty Garth of Waynes World is now "Pistachio Disguise" is terrible! The acting from EVERYONE in this film is terrible, the storyline is weaker and more helpless than an insect in a blender and the jokes are the height of immaturity and child like toilet humour. The "Turtle" Sketch is incredible.. When it comes to showing how unfunny this film is. Adam Sandlers production company has really got to be shaken up. If they thought this would be a good film then heaven help us if they want to make a second one or any other film along the same lines as this film.It was terrible. I'm almost frightened to say I liked Open Water more than this film... And I HATED Open Water. Please, please, please in the name of all the Aesir and Vanir. Stay away from this incoherent, never once comical drivel. If you want to see a Dana Carvey doing something funny, go watch Waynes World again. Please, avoid this film.AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!

Ugh. The only thing keeping me from rating this a 1 instead of a 2 is that I know just how bad movies can be. This movie ellicited a few laughs from my girlfriend and I due to some bizarre dialogue, but the more obvious humor in the movie fell flat on its face. We mostly sat through the film in nervous silence. What were Adam Sandler and Dana Carvey thinking? The fact that this "Master of Disguise" only really changed into a handful of disguises was also pretty poor. Phil Hartman could do more with his voice than they did with this film. I feel sorry for those of you who will suffer through it.

reviews.review_title: Stupid, stupid, stupid but the kids liked it
reviews.content: I had higher hopes for this being funny, given the trailer, but the acting was HORRIBLE. It was like the writers were sitting around saying "what else stupid could we put in?".  My 6 year old liked it though so I guess it was worth it but this is the second worst movie I've ever seen (the worst was Congo).

reviews.review_title: So bad that it becomes good...?
reviews.content: It's when it comes to films like this that I really start to question IMDb's rating system. Because how are you really supposed to rate a film? On the plot? The acting? Cinematography? Entertainment value? Because this one has a shitty plot, okay acting, and pretty bad cinematography and special effects. But the overall suckiness makes it very entertaining. Is it thereby worthy of more stars? I think so. The weirdness and lousy effects makes this film really funny, and if watched between 23:00 and 04:00; hilarious. Many quotable scenes that won't make sense to anyone who has not yet seen this masterpiece and many other scenes that are just cringe-worthy and better off forgotten about. Despite of the terrible rating and overall mediocre performance this really is a film worth watching. It shows the diversity in films produced and even if you won't like it it will give you perspective on what is good and what's not and you will be able to appreciate real quality movies even more.

reviews.review_title: See a Saturday matinee with lots of kids!
reviews.content: Master of Disguise was a great kid's flick. You'll enjoy it more if there are lots of kids in the audience to help get you laughing at some of the silly humor. The gags are funny and the humor is clean.
Gave this 4/10...because I just gave "Once upon in Mexico" a 3...and it wasn't much better...Overall, this movie had some semi-funny parts, but overall it was just kinda dumb...

reviews.review_title: Not 10/10 but have to compensate for the haters
reviews.content: Saw this on Netflix so saved to watch list to watch with my son (9yr old). Before watching I looked up reviews and nearly skipped it because of the low rating - glad that I didint.Don't get me wrong, it's best for kids-I wouldint watch it by myself, but as a fun family movie it was great! My young fulla loved it and was laughing throughout and for me it had plenty of reference to things that adults would recognise eg scarface etc.Do yourself a favour, slip the reviews, leave your expectations behind and if you want a good movie to watch with the kids grab your snacks and give this one a go. I certainly liked it more than allot of the newer movies for kids that are coming out.

reviews.review_title: Must be seen to be believed.
reviews.content: I like Dana Carvey. I've always thought he was funny from SNL to his own show on ABC. I even liked his film "Clean Slate" and "The Road to Wellness" wasn't that bad. But this film is arguably the worst waste of talent, celluloid, energy, or any other resource for that matter that has ever been put on film. Not only is the film not funny, it is difficult to even sit through. Had the plot developed out in a more tongue-in-cheek manner, it probably could have worked, but there would have to be a plot first. The character names alone give a hint at just how bad this film is. How do films like this get a green light? Who really thought this would be a hit? This film is an exercise in how to end your career and leave little chance for it being resurrected.

For my purposes, this title gets a 8 out of 10. Five for the movie itself, an extra two points for Mr. Spiner's diamond blue eyes, and one for the set designer who had the presence of mind to arrange Spiner's character's color scheme around them. Everything around "Devlin Bowman" is blue and white and the effect is quite striking.The movie is a ninety minute fart joke. I'm not kidding.Harold Gould, by far and away, delivers the best overall performance in the movie (such as it is). Casting James Brolin in this movie was a definite stroke of completely ridiculous genius. Austin Wolff is, of course, adorable, and Dana Carvey's particular brand of multiple personality disorder is as entertaining as ever (I got a definite chuckle out of Mr. Peru).Like I said, the movie is a ninety minute fart joke and is quite clearly directed at males between the ages of eight and twelve. If you have a roomful of those kind of people and you'd like them to stop breaking things by playing baseball with the ceiling fan, this movie will at least put them all in one room and occupy them with disgusting noises for about an hour and a half. There's no swearing. The (incredibly) mild "blue" content is really tame and based on a cartoony visual gag, as is the "violence". It's supposed to be a silly, sight gag based comedy and that's exactly what it is.As for Spiner (you knew I was getting to it); first of all, he's gorgeous. Like I said, the character's entire color scheme is a shade of electric blue that compliments his eyes to the point of being captivating. I was hitting the pause button just because I *had* to look. The jokes are (of course) at his character's expense (he *is* the bad guy, after all), and he, appropriately, rolls out his very best "smarmy/irritated" act (the one that stole "Out To Sea" right out from under two legends). It's amusing and relatively gentle right up until the climax of the movie, where he hits the "crazy button" and doesn't look back. Then it's just plain hilarious. In terms of Spiner-related content, I got exactly what I wanted out of this movie and just a little bit more.By the way, Classmates.com owes Spiner a big, wet kiss (trust me).

reviews.review_title: What a Terrible Dana Carvey Flick
reviews.content: I'm a Big fan of Dana..But this has to be the worst movie Ive ever seen....if u exclude Country Bears of course....I wouldnt reccomend any one to watch this movie....spend your time more wisely...go see Signs...or Goldmember was at least slightly more humorous....If you want to laugh at master of disguise...JUST WATCH THE TRAILER! ITs all there....

We saw this in the theater upon release. It was panned then just as it is now (by some, not all). Our family have always loved it and watch it/quote it regularly. That includes our younger children that were born after the movie was released.I get annoyed that it is frequently compared to Austin Powers when they are clearly aimed at different audiences, with the latter mainly relying on overly crude/lazy humor. Master of Disguise has an ongoing flatus joke that is uniquely funny because of the timing and that it is a parody of when the bad guy laughs. The movie has great production design, fun characters and visuals. The grouchy reviewers of this movies are not turtley enough for the Turtle Club.

I would like to start off by saying that 'stupid funny' is what I'm all about. I absolutely LOVED Austin Powers and all the other stupidly funny movies I can get my hands on. One of my floor mates rented The Master of Disguise and at times I wanted to heave my shoe at the TV. Parts made all so familiar in the trailers such as Dana repeating over and over and over again "Turtle, Turtle" was one such instance. Yet another would have to be him saying, "I want to be a master of disguise". If I had any doubts of how unoriginal and untalented Dana Carvey was, I have none now. I will make it a point to avoid ALL of his movies. I just wish he hadn't dragged 'Data' down with Dana, however he DID make a couple of parts in the movie laughable... Avoid this movie at all costs. If you are like me you will want to scream and stop watching it. If I was by myself and rented this movie on some way-way-way-outside chance I would have turned it off right after the "Turtle, Turtle" part no doubt.

reviews.review_title: Car Crash Comedy - Go see it! :-)
reviews.content:
Go see The Master Of Disguise, the new film staring Dana Carvey (Garth from Wayne's World). It's best if you take a kid with you aged between 6 and 10yrs. Any younger and they won't quite get it... Any older and they'll be horrified!! But in the middle, they'll just laugh their socks off and quote all the disgracefully unfunny lines until they're sick (or you are!!)
Just got back from seeing it with my daughter Sally - she has bellyache from laughing so much, and me and her dad were laughing a LOT too. Just not for the same reasons. It's delightfully crap, and in ALL seriousness, the very best bit is the end credits. No, really!  The final credits sequence contains some funny bits and pieces either not in the film or specially made for the credits, of the actors goofing about in a very embarrassing way. A kind of 'Something About Mary' style combo of out-takes and stuff. It's cut much snappier than the rest of the film, which was never gonna be American Beauty, but which suffers terribly from half-arsed direction and bad editing to give a very sluggish, embarrassingly badly timed, only-for-the-kids comedy film.It's gonna be famous though. Just probably not in a good way. Already touted as the Worst Film EVER Made, the critics are having a ball going on and on about Dana Carvey trying to be Mike Myers, and it being a vanity project. This is a little unfair. I don't think Carvey was trying to do that at all with this film, I think he just wanted to make a goofy comedy for kids, and it succeeds as that, if my 8 year old daughter Sally is anything to go by.It's not a good film by any stretch. It's a very very bad film. But kids will love it, and adults will just LOVE to see how very BAD it really is!! However, nowhere near the Worst film ever made. It's better than Forget Paris. Better than The Avengers. And at least as good as Howard the Duck! :-DI reckon the Vanity Project bandwagon that most critics have latched onto is just a little harsh. Carvey was on the right track here, but fell prey to bad editing and directing. The film needed pace and timing to pep up the obvious comedy enough to make the mums and dads enjoy it as much as the kids. It's very physical, goofy and embarrassingly puerile in places - just right for 6 to 10 yr olds who love Mr Bean, Emu and The Chuckle Brothers. Dana Carvey is harmless and unthreatening, but a long long way from cool. Kids will be fine with this - they aren't as judgemental as us grown-ups - but the critics will (are) have an absolute ball ripping it to shreds. I just wanted to redress the balance a bit, and maybe Dana Carvey will have the sense to draft me in on his next film to pep up the pace for him!Personally, it was great to take my daughter to a silly, goofy, old-fashioned, funny movie without worries about overt violence or sexual references, and she had an absolute whale of a time. I too really enjoyed screeching at the bad bits in a kind of Plan 9 From Outer Space frame of mind.Brent Spiner (Mr Data from Star Trek:The Next Generation) is perfectly awful. Truly. In a good way, though, and he's obviously got the crap comedy villain market covered. Fair play to him - someone has to do it, and it's nice that it's not some Englishman Cliché for once. I just hope he can laugh at himself there. A lot. A very lot.
Just go see it. It's Car Crash Comedy! It has to be seen to be believed.
Miss Gossage - Connoisseur of Very Bad Films!

We went to the drive in last night to see this.  Which Signs was playing on the other screen and me and the wife would have liked to switch but the boys 7 and 5 would not have got that one.  I like Dana Carvey movies and I like a lot of the stuff the kids watch.  I can even handle sponge Bob  but this was just stupid even more stupid then Sponge Bob Square pants.

reviews.review_title: No wonder he didn't make any other movies after this one...
reviews.content: I watched this movie (dubbed in Italian) this morning, as I was forced in bed due to a flu. I don't normally write negative reviews on IMDb, since tastes may vary and movies I didn't like might be good for others, but this one was so terrible that I felt the urgency to come online and post a warning to anyone who might conceive the idea of watching it. Please don't do it - this movie possibly classifies as one of the worst films ever, and not even of the "bad but involuntarily funny" type; rather of the "I'd rather be dead than watch this again" type.Basically, the movie revolves around Dana Carvey, who plays an idiot (or is an idiot - at least that's what I think now after watching the movie) who learns to disguise himself perfectly as other people. The entire movie is just an endless series of gags with Carvey disguised as characters who are supposed to be funny and are designed only to let you say "oh how good is Dana Carvey in disguising himself"; unfortunately, they instead are so obvious, dumb and hopeless that even a 4-year-old would find the movie boring.To make things worse, the writers decided that this was enough for the movie to work, so there is no real plot whatsoever, and you are even confronted with plain inconsistencies in the script - such as when Jennifer Esposito gets invited to the villain's party and introduces herself as "Barbara", but once she's there she's repeatedly called "Jennifer" by everyone. The villain is played by Brent Spiner and now I understand why his career started and ended with Star Trek; moreover, several supposed celebrities (Bo Derek in 2002? Jessica Simpson?) play cameos that should make you think how good is Carvey to disguise himself as these people, but they don't, since he doesn't disguise at all and just hired the real people instead.And when you eventually think that the movie has reached the minimum length to be allowed into theatres so to reap your money and let you go home, Carvey pops up again with just about the worst imitation of George W. Bush ever made, and then tortures you with minutes and minutes and minutes of unfunny bloopers, and no, that's not enough, after the bloopers and final titles end, he feels the need to add an even less funny scene in which he reveals the dwarf that operates the wooden puppet in the movie, and starts to chat with him, and you just want to shoot him, the dwarf and the entire TV set.Bottom line: Dana Carvey should not be allowed in front of a camera again, unless he can expiate by watching Naked Gun and Hot Shots at least a hundred times to learn how to do stupid movies properly!

reviews.review_title: I wanted to spoon out my eyes...
reviews.content: As a loyal Garth fan, I walked in expecting something at the very least, entertaining. I expected silly, but not inane. Nothing was funny or entertaining. Nothing was amusing. All was simply stupid. I didn't laugh ONCE. Why famous stars would cameo in this drivel is beyond me. I think less of Governor Ventura and Michael Johnson now for their participation. LESS than 1 out of 10.

I don't think I'm capable of expressing just how truly awful this film was. It's a total mystery to me as to how it was ever made.The storyline was inane, ludicrous and just plain weak.  After the first 20 minutes or so, I thought that the 'set up' was talking way too long, but then nothing followed it!  I like Dana Carvey, and would have liked to have liked this film, but it wasn't possible - it had no redeeming qualities whatsoever (with the possible exception of Jennifer Esposito).I'm trying to recall one moment when I laughed and am singularly failing. I generally like silly humour, but there was nothing here that was remotely risable.The impressions were good (particularly the Al Pacino), but some were pointless.  What the heck was that turtle thing all about?  How did the writers and producers ever contemplate for one moment that there was going to be nothing amusing about a man in a turtle suit.Really, really terrible.  Maybe Dana can't carry a film on this own - perhaps teaming up with Adam Sandler (executive producer on this travesty) for a future venture may be the best he can hope for.

I don't understand how so many people hate this movie! I think it's just gang mentality or something because this is a really funny movie. Is it a good movie? Hell no! What kind of fool would walk into "Master of Disguise" expecting a solid piece of captivating story telling? Master of Disguise is nothing more than a bunch of childish jokes and impressions that are thrown in for no good reason other than to showcase carvie's talent. And guess what? they're hilarious! The best thing about this movie is everyone involved knows the movie is just ridiculous but the cast puts everything they've got into it anyway and play their characters as if they were serious.I could imagine kids would laugh at this like crazy! I love the joke about how the disguisees only like women with huge hips and in one scene the dana carvie and his uncle are admiring this fat lady from behind, but then the lady turns around and its this fat guy with a beard wearing a dress!!! both of them recoil in disgust! Stupid? yes but it works for some reason. I enjoyed it a lot!

The Master of Disguise is a poor excuse for a movie, having almost no plot and like 3 funny scenes. I generally enjoy Dana Carvey but this time I reluctantly must criticize. I enjoy critiquing movies but I don't even remember the plot. It seemed like a television skit that was lengthened to make a film. There were a total of 3 scenes that I thought were funny, but the rest left me groaning. Sorry to say this but thumbs down to Master of Disguise.

reviews.review_title: Take your kids to see this, if they insist
reviews.content: I didn't go into this movie expecting a plot, but I was still terribly disappointed.  I was expecting the plot to make at least a little sense, maybe not be a plot that i cared about, but enough to get me through the movie.  It was full of more holes than "Die Another Day", as people just appeared in other places without an explanation. The one redeeming factor of this movie should have been Carvey's impersonations(isn't that really why everyone wanted to see it?), but I found them inane and nowhere near as good as his SNL work.  I look forward to seeing him in a more suitable vehicle where his talents won't be wasted in mindless drivel such as this.

As funny as Dana Carvey tried to be... the movie fell short of his comedic skills. True at times you couldnt help but laugh at some of his antics, it was a really hard movie to believe. And the insistent appearance of the boom mike in a bout half the scenes was VERY annoying.

I saw this movie through a drive way, it was like a drive through movie and I saw it, and it was terrible movie and the part was ok, but while I was watching the whole thing. It was so terrible of how he plays the guy and the wrost part he said: It might work, in a dumb way. I really hated this movie and I give it a thumb down, and feel free to respond and talk to you soon everyone!!!

I rented this movie because I needed ideas for a "disguise" movie I'm writing, but I stopped watching after the first 10 minutes. The film had all the hackneyed beats: the wimpy hero who has yet to grow into his powers; the save the cat moment when he cheers up a small boy by letting him play with his dog; the "slings and arrows" when he is bullied by the character who steals his girlfriend. There's no problem with the beats (they are the foundation of every successful movie) but they stood out like lumps in oatmeal. And they were neither funny nor dramatic not believable. This movie was a waste of a talented comedian and I wondered why it was so bad. Then I remembered that Happy Gilmore Productions is Adam Sandler's movie and, except for "Punch Drunk Love," all of Sandler's movies are sloppy and juvenile and not very funny. Watch this movie only if your are besotted with Adam Sandler's humor (?) otherwise give it a wide berth. If only Carvey had had the strength to say no.

reviews.review_title: A torture to watch from a master to mourn
reviews.content:
Watching this movie is like having a root-canal without anesthetics, while someone is ramming a white-hot poker into your behind. I love Dana Carvey, and I'm convinced he's one of the best comedians around, so I'm simply incapable of understanding how, and why, he could put such a painful failure on the silver screen. To add insult to injury, he also co-wrote the script, which means he has absolutely NO excuses!Have you seen "Dumb and Dumber"? Well, "The Master of Disguise" will make it look like "The Godfather". Heck, even "Battlefield Earth" will seem like a majestic masterpiece by comparison! The characters are cliched, flat, and deadly boring, and there is not a SINGLE joke or situation that anybody aged 3 and above will find even remotely funny.I always feel I owe the creators of any movie at least as much as to watch their film from the beginning to the end once I rented it, but this time I actually had to cover my eyes to survive this torture, and ran the entire garbage with the time-counter on-screen to keep my hopes - and thus myself - alive. There is not a moment, not a single scene, not a single character that's interesting. The only part of this movie that's remotely watchable is the opening credits, which do have a certain Indiana Jones/Tomb Raider feel to them - in spite of the fact that it's supposed to be a comedy.
Before I've seen it, I thought the critics were overly harsh. I really WANTED to enjoy this movie. I was ready to overlook a lot if it had at least one or two redeeming scenes. Now I can understand why they talk about "The Master of Disguise" as the worst movie of the year; I'd call it the worst movie of the century.

reviews.review_title: stop taking this movie so seriously
reviews.content: i am sick of all you people who are saying this is the worst movie ever or that is not funny. ITS A FRIGGIN KIDS MOVIE!!! if your gonna take a movie like this that seriously u shouldn't watch comedies.. or any other movie for that matter. it was for kids, it makes kids laugh, so thats all that matters. we need more good kid shows like this. i agree it wasn't my favorite Dana Carvey movie but thats not the point. to all of you that say this is the worst movie ever, obviously you've never seen Ghost Lake or Gili. now those are movies that deserve bad criticsm. leave the kids movies alone. there not meant to win Oscars or any other award, they're just meant to entertain kids and people with an open mind, which this movie does successfully. if your gonna see this movie, i recommend that you have one or the other. just stop giving it such negative feedback. all it does is make you sound like an idiot for dissing a movie,or watching a movie for that matter, meant for eight year old's. And to all of you who honestly thought is was a movie for older people and thought it would have "adult humor" how damn stupid can you be. what in the previews or trailers made it sound adult, was it the slapping machine, the turtle scene, the meant-to-be-fake Italian accent, because all those things just scream "PG-13". dumbasses. this may seem a little harsh and rude, but from what i've read about this movie and the harsh criticism its been getting, you all deserve it.

reviews.review_title: You idiots! How can you hate this?
reviews.content: I thought this was a great film, I laughed my ass off! Can't you pinkos sit back and enjoy the finer points of this...dare I say it? Classic. I mean sure, like any other film, it had its rougher elements such as Pistasicios mother who I disliked immensely (and who was a voice in a cartoon I can't put my finger on) but I though this hardly affected the plot. I especially liked the villains' farting jokes (yeah, that's right) not to mention the Lincoln speech, man that bit cracked me up. But what confuses me is that you people couldn't handle the silliness of the film, the weight of your reality has destroyed your viewing pleasure. You might have gotten used to your linear life of work, family, weekend leisure in a constant cycle, but perhaps you don't realise the damage it has done to your mind and soul. Also being your inability to appreciate the humour of a child (I'm 15 so it hasn't escaped me yet fortunately) A good film, not a perfect one mind you yet still worth watching if you have the soul.

reviews.review_title: The most amazing thing about this movie.......
reviews.content: Is that there are people that have a high enough IQ to write a review, and actually liked it. One of the worst films of all time. I have not been a Carvey fan after SNL but you have to expect more from a guy with his comedic timing and characterization ability. I can only imagine how he must have felt when this wrapped and he looked at the finished product. I can only assume he missed the daily's as any reasonable person would have quit after the first day. That's how bad the film is. There isn't a single scene that isn't embarrassing. The characters are absurd, the acting atrocious, the plot non existent. No question, this movie is a wonderful example of why IMDb should allow zero stars for their reviews. It absolutely doesn't rate the one star I gave it. The idea that people would recommend this movie with a straight face only goes to show what kind of trouble the population at large is really in. I have to think the caretakers of those who enjoyed the movie wrote the review for them because nobody with a IQ higher than 50 could have thought anything other than this movie was an incredible disaster.

It's sad when the best part of a movie is that its less then an hour and a half.  If you seen the previews, you've seen the movie so don't waste your time on this one.  I think the writers spend too much time in creating all the characters that Dana Carvey's character impersonates and forgot to come up with a halfway decent story to give these characters something to do besides a few lines and then onto the next character.My guess is that Barbra Streisand must have told James Brolin to get a job or get out. That's the only reason I can see him making this movie.

Look, I'm all for silly movies and I dug the Austin Powers trilogy, but this was just sad. Dana Carvey plays a 23 year old when we know he's 47 at the time (see the problem there?). Most of his dialogue is saying something stupid, and attempting to make us laugh because the movie seems to be under the misconception that random sight gags are funny. The only reason it worked in Austin Powers is because they were smartly done. Here most of them are so hammy you can't enjoy them. On a worse note we have James Brolin as the father and Edie McClurg as the mother. It seems like their only purpose is to have two big names. Brolin's performance is so over the top it's embarrassing and McClurg is well... McClurg, she can only do so much. Spiner as Devlin Bowman is a fart happy crazy man who was put in jail by Brolin's guy. And I do mean fart happy. He does it as comedic relief expecting we'll think the joke is funny if done enough. Fart jokes really just aren't funny. So if you want a smarter movie, scrap this and rent the Austin Powers trilogy.

This is the most lame, unfunny, difficult to understand movie I have ever seen.  I actually contemplated buying the DVD just so I could smash it against the wall.  Don't just walk but run away from this nightmare of a movie.  Dana Carvey is much too funny to have actually conceived this brain-dead idea.  I'm hoping his next venture will be better; however, in comparison to this bomb - a movie about animal cruelty would be funnier than the Master of Disaster.

I've read some very negative comments on this movie before I watched it, but I tried to keep an open mind. Still, this is one of the worse movies I've ever seen, an utter waste of money. Though it was a senseless `comedy', there was not a single laugh in it. I remember Dana Carvey with a smile, from the `Wayne's World' days, and if he were there today he'd say: `I'm having fun.not!' I don't believe this is the end of Dana, I've seen him acting naturally, and he's one hilarious chap. He was just caught with his pants down this time, or worse, with his pants in his hands. I don't think anyone involved in this film had any fun at all, and the after-movie bloopers are just a sham. Better luck next time Dana.

reviews.review_title: So Awful You Won't Believe Just How Awful
reviews.content: Comedy Italian accents.Not funny!Calling the main character Pistachio.Really not funny.Who decided this monstrosity was worth making?He/She should go into the garbage business! What genius studio head decided to allow this total waste of talent,energy and resources to be released. Likewise,the garbage business! AAAARGHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!! An insult to even a particularly dim-witted worm's intelligence.

reviews.review_title: Very Bad, just to be nice...
reviews.content: This movie where Dana can make great impersonations but can not make a movie from it. Mike Myers (close friend of Dana Carvey) can be real creative with his characters, but Dana needs a lot of work to catch the speed of Mr. Myers. The kids had a few laughs but I didn't find anything funny. overall 2/10

2nd movie in my life I've walked out on in the middle and I've seen some really bad ones.   Usually even a bad movie has at least one redeeming feature, one scene, one performance worth taking pity on and saying, "Nice Try!".  Osama Bin Laden should be tied to a chair, have his eyelids surgically removed, and forced to watch this for the rest of eternity.

Fine fine fine, ok... if you want to trash this movie go ahead. But I think the people who are trashing Master of Disguise went into the theater expecting latenight SNL humor that, if you were watching in the late 80's and early 90's, wasn't always kiddie material.Master of Disguise is just about FUN - and in that it excels because the level of fun is for kids. I enjoyed the film, and still enjoy being cutely-irritating to my girlfriend by quoting the film, possibly because I'm incredibly immature - but also possibly because I'm dynamic enough to appreciate multiple levels of humor. Dana Carvey did a great job on this project and I would love to see him do more, but with the 25-35 audience in mind this time :)

reviews.review_title: Not all SNL graduates get a degree in film.
reviews.content: As much as I may have liked Dana Carvey on SNL, this movie is a very poor display of his talent.  Dana has been dealt some bad hands lately with his smart comedy show being prematurely cancelled, his heart surgery mishap, and being out of the public spotlight for so long.  His other SNL friends are making money, so why not him too?The movie was just an excuse to dress up and act silly, and the characters are not some of his better ones.  Much of the jokes were references to pop culture, a cheap trick that will date the movie very soon.  The only laughs from the audience were the cheaply low reoccurring fart jokes.  The plot was incoherent and it jumped around too much the editor must have been drunk. The outtakes and gags while the credits were rolling would make even Jackie Chan woozy.On a positive note, this movie was very clean.  There were a few minor PG jokes, but this movie could be shown unedited on TV.  In an age where crude jokes are the norm to get a laugh, this movie, for the most part, avoided it.  Kids might find it amusing, but that's about it.  I so wanted him to be funny, but too bad the movie is just...well...bad.

I got dragged along to this film by my children - 7 and 9 years old. They seemed to enjoy the fart gag and some of the characterisations. However, for an adult viewer the humour is lame and most of the gags can be seen coming well before they arrive.Some of the characters portrayed would be well over the heads of the target audience of children - how many would have seen Scarface, for instance? Or understand the references to Bo Derek?The running gag about the males of the family being besotted with fat-bottomed women is also puzzling.This is a quite short film - the lengthy gag reel over the closing credits shows numerous deleted scenes. Perhaps their inclusion might at least have provided a few more gags for your dollar. Then again, why prolong the agony?
Next time kids, I choose the film.

reviews.review_title: Comedy will never be the same.
reviews.content: My initial impressions of Master of Disguise were those of disgust and, frankly,  non-interest.  Yet,  I found myself in the movie theatre opening night,  captivated by the genius of Dana Carvey (who after appearing in this role,  will probably be in high demand for more prestigious,  academy award worthy roles).  The film I saw could be just a precursor to something more magnificent,  because I hate to say that this is the pinnacle of Dana Carvey's career.  For this well-known comedy actor,  the highest respect has come a rough path of sketch comedy on SNL and the much loved "Waynes World" films.  Most successful comedy actors rarely get this opportunity in their careers,  and Carvey will more than definitely ride this phenomena of success from Master of Disguise to fame.  If you are unfamiliar with the film and would like to be surprised,  then don't read below here because this section may contain spoilers and give away much of the intricate plot (reminiscent of great works like Chinatown or the Big Lebowski).Pistachio Disguisey is a professional assassin named Leon.  Leon is an adroit mercenary,  able to take on several deadly thugs at one time.  As skilled as Leon is,  his achilles heal is amiable nature,  which jeopardizes his ability to accomplish the one task that has haunted him throughout his life:  to kill the drug cartel leader responsible for the death of his pet goldfish,  Walnut.  Throughout the film,  Leon's gregarious nature and ability to fit in at parties blindly negates his motivation to take care of this one thing,  and that is why movie is so long. The film,  if my watch isn't mistaken,  came slightly in under three hours.  The disguises have no practical application other than to amuse the children,  which is the only disappointing thing;  it is tiring to see Hollywood exploit it's focus groups to the point where it is blatantly obvious, especially on a film that might be an Oscar contender.  There are some loveable characters in the film like Darryl the blind Tupperware salesman,  the irate overweight housewife, and the notorious heroin addict police officer most deservingly named Neddy Needles.  The violence is mostly tongue and cheek,  however,  it must be said that it may be inappropriate for the younger children.It's a rare treat that such a fine film comes to theatres on major release and not just to art house movie theatres in larger cities.  I recommend seeing this film at least three times just because it makes so much more sense after many viewings.  My judgment:  9 out of 10 stars

reviews.review_title: A family movie, and I pity you parents.
reviews.content: Both my wife and I went to this movie thinking sure it's a kids movie but that doesn't mean it can't be a neat experience. Unfortunately the only joke that my wife and I laughed at was an abortive fart joke. The reason we laughed? The look on Brent Spinner's face that I'm not sure should have been left in the movie.As a family movie it is probably pretty good, but should have been direct to video where you parents can at least sit in the next room.

I liked this movie alot. It wasn't that funny, but it's a good family movie. The flatulence joke (the biggest running gag in the movie) was actually funny! Also the best disguise was Terry Suave. "This is what you're doing. This is what I want you to do." One of the best lines I've heard in a movie in awhile. My only complaint is that Pistachio's grandfather was a tad bit mean. The scene near the end with the cherries and how it's a takeoff on action movies was very cute. All in all, go see this movie with no expectations and you won't be disappointed.

The Master of Disguise is not the greatest movie that was ever made, but its not that bad either. It is nice to see a movie that doesn't have to rely on profanity to carry the day. The plot is thin and is really secondary to the humor provided by Carvey and the cast(especially Brent Spiner and veteran actor Harold Gould). If you have not seen this movie be warned: If you are going to see a spectacular comedy in the Austin Powers/Men in Black mode, that is not what you will get. If you want to see a movie that has some good laughs and some interesting cameos, this is it. The humor was interesting and mostly funny(though I thought the farting bit of the Spiner character went a little too far). I do think the kids will enjoy this movie and so will Dana Carvey fans!!

reviews.review_title: Disguised as a funny movie, don't be fooled!
reviews.content: I was forcing myself to laugh through "Master of Disguise", but then I'm not a little kid who'll laugh at anything.  I love "dumb funny" movies, but this is just dumb.  I'm a fan of Carvey's SNL work, which is what lead me to rent this (luckily it was an earned free rental!) and give it benefit of the doubt.  The movie lasts a total of 1 hour and 20 minutes, which is why I actually made it through.  The film is slow and unfunny in the beginning, but I thought it would pick up when Carvey started doing characters/disguises...it didn't.  Its sad when the running fart joke is funnier than Dana Carvey.  The film is a HappyMadsion production, which means Sandler was involved, but it didn't help.  Sandler was also involved in Hot Chick, so what.  Dana Carvey and the guy who wrote Deuce Bigalow wrote Master of Disguise.  If you want to laugh, rent Deuce Bigalow.  If you want to entertain the small kids in your family, rent Master of Disguise. Carvey is funny and a skilled impersonator, but in the right context. Master of Disguise never finds that context.  Maybe the movie was meant only for small kids, like Pokemon and anything with Frankie Muniz in it.  If thats the case, I feel dumb for even reviewing it.  I'm not the audience. The problem is Master of Disguise is Dana Carvey and he's never done little kid movies before so why now?  If you must see this for yourself, please rent it.  Don't go spend $17 on a DVD expecting SNL humor, theres none of it here.

reviews.review_title: Not the best, but definitely not the worst.
reviews.content: I accidentally taped this movie one night a long time ago, when I was about 9 or 10. I watched it the next day, and I thought it was hilarious. Granted, that was 4 or 5 years ago, but I still think it's a pretty funny movie. Dana Carvey is a comedic genius, and I thought his part in this film was fantastic. The fact that he masquerades as a lot of slightly retarded and incredibly funny characters is probably the reason why. I look at this movie and I think, now why couldn't I do that? This movie is definitely aimed at audiences who love low-brow, stupid comedy, but for a movie that is aimed at those people, it is actually fairly good. It could have been a lot worse. With quite a few laugh-out-loud moments, this movie redeems itself from the amateur acting, many goofs, and silly storyline. The acting is . . . reasonable, for a movie of this standard, and although the storyline is beyond silly, it fits the whole comedic theme of the movie. So, this movie will be okay for anyone who doesn't mind stupid comedy and is just looking for a laugh.

reviews.review_title: Come on guys this film was damn funny.
reviews.content:
Ill admit that theres a lot of slapstick humour here, but it was Very funny, I can only assume that its because of the yankee sense of humour which only seems to understand certain types of humour, so U dont get a lot of English humour like "Fawlty Towers", the many "Monty Python" films, "Benny Hill", Frank Spencer in "Some Mothers do 'ave 'em", "Steptoe and Son" - The list in endless.
All I can say is that this film does NOT deserve to be listed in the worst 100 films.Its people like you that stopped "Serving Sara" to be released in this country, even though I have watched it and found it thouroughly enjoyable too, not quite as hilarious as this film but close.

Kay The Master of Disguise was funny the first time I saw it because I can take kiddish humor. The second time I saw it, it went into so-so territory. Third time, there was only one part that was funny (my name is gammy, gammy numb-numbs)that lasts about 50 seconds which isn't worth the ordeal it puts us through.The plot revolves around Pistachio, a thirty year old waiter who puts his underwear on his head and puts on a shaving cream beard, gets a cane and thinks hes a Shepperd. If that not a sign of a bad movie I don't know what is. Anyway his father is kidnapped and his grandfather enters in Exorcist fashion and tell him that he is in a family of people who can change their personalities to fight crime and Pistachio must find his inner master of disguise to save his parents.I wonder if this looked good on paper because that cherry pie man was a little childish even for this movie, not to mention stupid. I have friends who are my age and love this movie and I can't believe it because it's so stupid but they adore it and think I'm crazy for not liking it. But you no everyone is entitled to their opinion.Bottom line: Sucks except for a drag part that is pretty funny. I still can't believe i spent 10 bucks to buy this crap. And on a brighter note this movie single handedly ruin Dana Carveys career and my one friend who likes this and Wayne's World can't believed that happened.Grade: */****

I didn't expect sophisticated humor, but this film was a total mess. . and a shame. Dana is abundantly talented, but like Martin Short, crafting a film to spotlight that talent remains an elusive challenge. I hope he gets another chance to do it right. c

reviews.review_title: Great Film For The Correct Audience - 8 year old boys
reviews.content: This is the perfect film for an eight year old boy. It's a little crude, but not overly so. It has some physical humor and sight gags that almost everybody will find amusing. It is a just a little over 80 minutes long, another plus. It's not like you are investing "Lawrence of Arabia" like time into this. It has some mild comic violence, think Three Stooges for level of violence and then crank it back a little bit. This movie suffers from what several movies made by refugees from Saturday Night Live have suffered from - it is incredibly difficult to make a full length motion picture out of a three minute skit. Dana Carvey does over the top caricatures familiar to anyone who watched SNL when Carvey was in the cast. I watched this film several years ago and thought it was pretty dumb. I watched it again with my eight year old grandson and his appreciation of it made me rethink my opinion a bit. It is not a "date night" film, for sure, but if you are a babysitter of boys 6-10 years old this will hold their attention and make them laugh.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely stinko - abysmal waste of a great comedian's talent
reviews.content: This movie is simply unwatchable. A word of advice for those who haven't seen "The Master of Disguise": for those of you - like me - who loved Dana Carvey's impressions and comedy on SNL, remember him that way. I thought he was in the top 5 SNL cast members ever, and it was always a mystery to me why Adam Sandler & Chris Rock (fair-to-middling SNL alumni IMO) became stars while some of the true comedic geniuses like Phil Hartman and Dana Carvey didn't get top roles. In Mr. Carvey's case, the mistake of being in this film show that making good choices is of paramount importance to those aspiring to move on to the big screen. The movie is never funny and isn't even "bad" good. It just stinks. He plays a character named "Pistachio Disguisey". COME ON - my 5-year-old nephew could come up with a wittier name, and believe me, he wouldn't laugh at even the most infantile jokes in this flick. I defy any adult to even crack a smile. If you do, you must be on acid. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

Normally, before I watch a movie I look it up here, and check director, actors to see if I have seen anything of their work. This time I didn't and it cost me 1,5 hours watching this crap. I had seen the trailer and it was all right, but the rest of the movie suffers from terrible direction and even worse editing. And I should have known. When I look at the films Perry Andelin Blake was involved with, Happy gilmore is the only one I would consider giving more than a 5/10. Co-writer Harris goldberg gave us the awful Deuce Bigalow.conclusion: One of the worst movies I have ever seen, but because I had very few laughs I give it 2/10 instead of 1/10 (it wasn't as bad as blues brothers 2000)

reviews.review_title: Awful but a few brilliant impersonations
reviews.content: It's astounding to observe the striking contrast between staggering genius and sheer idiocy. Most of the movie is laughably and painfully bad, but Carvey shines through in brilliant moments like when he impersonates Pacino in Scarface and Robert Shaw in Jaws. How can such a talented and funny mimic be at once in his element and at the same time so ridiculously unfunny? Dana Carvey was one of SNL's funniest, and he shows he's still got it, he just doesn't seem to have it consistently.

I thought this movie was halarious. I think this movie was very well done. I was surprised that critics didn't like it. It was great. I laughed at least 19 times! I Love Dana Carvey's acting and I'll see almost anything that he's one of the main charachers in. 10 stars!

reviews.review_title: Good candidate for the worst movie ever
reviews.content: Even horrible movies such as Howard the Duck, Caddyshack 2, and Nothing But Trouble at least are so bad that they are funny just for being so bad. This movie is just plain bad. Dana Carvey is so much better than this, a real shame.

reviews.review_title: I disguised myself as a sleeping person while watching this movie
reviews.content: Quite possibly Dana Carvey's worst movie ever made, this made me dumber by the second. The acting is of the utmost horrible quality and the attempts at making the audience laugh are horrible. The only pleasure you will get out of this movie is the opening credits and the end credits. The only chuckle I had was the scenes that poked fun at the Exorcist and Jaws. Whenever I hang out with some of my friends we always watch this god awful movie because it is one of my friends favorite movies. At no point in the movie did I enjoy it. Yes, this is, somewhat, of a short review, but, all in all, don't go out of your way and see it. In fact, don't see this film at all unless you are under the age of 12 and have the mental capacity of a 5 year old.

I recently went to see "Master of Disguise", Dana Carvey's new "movie". I put the word "movie" in quotes because I think the word "exposé" would better encompass the thing that I saw. Countless times during the show I found myself asking "What the f***?" Nevertheless, it was incredibly humorous. At times I didn't know if it was a kid's movie or if it should have had a higher rating that it's PG. It left me dumbfounded and confused, yet delightfully elated. I agree with the guy above when he says:
"One cannot begin to hopefully comprehend or decipher all the psychological & stereotypical boundaries this film breaks. It is a surprise to find this film in mainstream theaters as a film on this level & caliber would normally only be found in the finest arthouse theaters. If you plan on seeing Master of Disguise, I suggest keeping your afternoon free, as after viewing, no after witnessing it, you'll need the rest of the afternoon to invest in deciphering the dense narrative."If humor is caused by the momentary break down of logic in our brains or surprising results, this movie takes full advantage of each of these. It definitely had the feel of Dana Carvey, reminiscent of his short-lived TV show. I highly recommend it, since few others probably will.

reviews.review_title: The best part was the credits
reviews.content: This movie was horrible in almost every way.  The acting was poor, and the characters were very annoying.  The plot was almost nonexistant, and the writers relied on continuing about three jokes throughout the film which were not even funny to begin with.  This is not a film I would recommend to any adult, however the three young children I was with enjoyed it.  If your children want to see it, I would recommend hiring a babysitter to take them, because it is worth the twenty dollars you would spend on the babysitter not to expose yourself to such senseless tripe.  In all honesty the best part of the film was the ending credits, which included funny outtake scenes.

I like Dana Carvey, but this was not a funny movie.  In 'my' audience, only the fart jokes got laughs, and then only from the younger kids. I think probably the closing credits were funnier than the movie itself. My only laugh came during the closing credits where one of Carvey's characters was feeding a slice of cheese to a cobra.  Wait for the video; it will be out soon.

I took my two children to see this film at the drive-in after they had been inundated with the commercials for a few weeks on the Cartoon Network and Nickelodean.  They loved the scenes involving the Turtle Man that we have all seen in the broadcast previews. Unfortunately, this scene as played in the actual film has moments in the trailer that are not in the movie. These happen to be the moments they found the most amusing. This was disappointment number one for them.Disappointment two was that the film wasn't that good -- and they barely laughed throughout it. I myself felt lucky the film seemed to only last for about an hour.  Then the credits seemed to roll on for almost as long as the actual film showcasing outtakes and additional scenes. It was rather obvious from watching these outtakes and additional tidbits that entire scenes and sequences where removed from the film. Lucky for us they were excised, unluckily they were left in the credits.The saving grace for the entire night was that this was a double feature with Stuart Little 2, which they did enjoy quite a bit.

reviews.review_title: Perhaps the worst movie I've seen in five years
reviews.content: Some comedies work, and others don't.  This one doesn't.  You can just see Dana Carvey sitting around a table with some prospective producer, "Okay, I'll be this guy, a member of the Disguisey family, and we're masters of disguise.  My parents get kidnapped, and I have to use my new found disguising powers to get them free.  There will be a good looking female asistant, of course, and hilarious disguises and scenes.  You'll love it." What I can't visualize, is a producer saying, "Yes! What a great idea!"Perhaps the emptiness of the comedy in this movie can be summarized by the fact that the biggest laugh they get, and one the movie goes back to perhaps ten times, is flatulence.  Farting.  Wow.  Really funny.  Maybe I am unable to appreciate that kind of comedy any more, but even my eleven year old didn't laugh at that, or anything else.  I didn't even crack a smile.  Not once.  Not for the entire movie.As to the other review that says this movie contains deep social commentary and references to other movies, sure, there are some echoes of other films, but it is meaningless and adds nothing.  I've laughed harder at beer commercials than at this movie.  Do yourself a favor. Save your money.

reviews.review_title: Awesome as a kid, terrible as a teenager
reviews.content: When i was about 10 years old, this was one of my favourite films. I thought it was hilarious! Now being 17, I can now see how bad this movie actually was. Acting is pretty lame, fart jokes are over-used, all the elements of a bad movie. Pop culture references don't give this film any favors.What impresses me most about the film is Dana Carvey. His impersonations are above average, and save this film from being horrible. Kids will love this, adults may get a chuckle from the impersonations, but it won't please critics.

I wish someone had warned me that this was a kids movie...and that I would better spend the time gouging my eyes out then watching this crap. There were no jokes. None! The accents were terrible, the acting even worse, and the repeated fart joke had the children around me in hysterics but really didn't cut the cheese for me, so to speak.The opening scene with Bo Derek was funny and boded well, but I should have left as soon as the scene ended. Don't waste your time on this movie, and don't reduce your children to this level, there are better, cleverer, FUNNIER films for children out there.

reviews.review_title: Is this supposed to be for kids?
reviews.content: So I saw this film for the first time when I was 8. Of course as an 8 year old, I found this film to be hilarious, but I recall my mother finding it absolutely stupid. I remember every kid in my school was talking about the film and quoting it not long after it came out. Now I have re-watched this film as a young adult, and I'm constantly wondering who was the intended audience for this film? The film is rated PG-13, and it's obvious because some of the humour is inappropriate for children. Ironically, most of the humour in the film would only be funny to someone under the age of 12. Overall, the film basically feels like a watered down, more childish imitation of Austin Powers. I can honestly see why this film has been long forgotten by the majority of the population.

reviews.review_title: Classic Dana Carvey, Hysterical Family Fun
reviews.content: The only way that you can't enjoy Dana Carvey is if you take yourself way too seriously, you have absolutely no sense of humor, or you've been jaded by the junk spewed from the bowels of Disney and other movie houses that mass produce flicks that purport to be entertaining. From his days with Saturday Night Live, when he kept audiences in stitches with his rendition of Church Lady and Hanz and Franz, Dana Carvey is, hands down, one of the best comedians, and this movie has been long in coming.Compared to the summer's other highly touted offerings for kids -- Lilo & Stitch, Scooby Doo, Crocodile Hunter, et. al. -- The Master of Disguise wins, hands down. Not only was it truly targeted toward its audience with a lack of cursing, but the crude humor that accompanies any SNL's performance was far enough over the head of the kids in the audience that only the parents were laughing.Obviously, the movie wasn't intended to have a plot that will garner any Oscar nominations. That was never the point. It's mindlessly stupid, which is what Dana Carvey is all about. But when you enter the theater, you know that. So you sit back with your drink and your candy, take a deep breath, and get ready to laugh your way through the entire thing, which is exactly what all 9 of us did.Thanks, Dana Carvey, for giving my kids and me one good laugh at this movies this summer before heading back to school.

reviews.review_title: It pains me to say this, but ...
reviews.content: It really pains me to say this, but this movie was dreadful. I'm a huge Carvey fan, but I came away from this one very disappointed. Has he lost his touch? I don't think so, but I'm not going to use this movie as evidence to back up my point.This movie was so disjointed, and many of the "characters" were flat-out contrived and stupid. Carvey's strengths aren't the contrived characters, but his impersonations of real people (could he have done more George W. Bush and less of the turtle?). Other than Carvey, the only redeeming quality for this piece of junk was the fact that it was so short.Four stars out of ten, but two of them are just for Carvey.

reviews.review_title: Lots of Silliness - But, what else?
reviews.content: The Genre was listed as `Children's Comedy' . Boy, they ain't whistlin' Dixie!  My 5 year old granddaughter got a big kick out of it and laughed through most of it.  What made her laugh the most were the fart sounds (and me, too, unfortunately).It wasn't the worst movie in the world, but it could have been much better. The main problem, it seems to me, is that they seemed to allow Dana Carvey to simply ad lib almost throughout the film.  People like Carvey, Robin Williams (when he's doing comedy) and Jim Carrey need to be restrained somewhat by a more cohesive script or plan.  They wear you out after awhile! Carvey didn't shut up throughout the whole movie.  His approach seems to just be silly for about 95 minutes (lots more because a lot seemed to have been cut).  It's like throwing stuff on the wall to see what sticks.There were some funny moments and Dana Carvey is talented, after all.  I'm just saying that the film could have been of much better quality if it were better scripted and controlled. I'm not saying Carvey should be stifled. But the writers (Carvey and another guy) and producers (Adam Sandler - one of 2 executive producers) need to develop a better format, not just let a comedian run wild.There were a lot of comedic situations and much silliness.  The question is, do you want quality humor or simply quantity?

This movie I saw with some friends and at the end of the movie we all felt kind of empty, it just did nothing for anyone watching it. Dana Carvey is quite funny, but still he was not as good as he could be I think that this movie is worth seeing once and only once after that it should be never seen again, this will not be on my DVD christmas list this year.

reviews.review_title: An absolutely terrible movie. VHS by September.
reviews.content: Once again, proof that 5 minute Saturday Night Live skits can't be threaded together to create a satisfying 90 minute movie.  This movie is dreadful. Even the resort to animal gags was terrible.  Much of the funny stuff was in the outtakes at the end of the show.  Really sad.

I really liked Master of Disguise.  It was a great family movie.  I was so glad to see Dana Carvey back on the big screen after all the problems he's had.  I think people should give Dana SOME credit.  Afterall he DID make the movie for his children.

reviews.review_title: It takes a few viewings to appreciate.
reviews.content: The production of this movie is pretty weak. It's disjointed and doesn't flow very well. I have to admit, after the first time seeing it I thought it was awful, but my 8 year old daughter and 4 year old son have it on tape and think it's hilarious. So I watched it with them again and after seeing it for the second time I remembered some really funny characters Dana Carvey does. The third time I watched it I found it to be extremely funny. It definitely grows on you.One of the reviews I read here said that the characters Dana does aren't funny, but they couldn't be further from the truth. He does a character based on Tony Montana from Scarface that is hilarious! He also does a character named Gammy Numnums, which is an older snobby woman and is one of the funniest characters in the movie. The problem is that he does so many characters that none of them last long enough. His turtle-man character is really funny and gets funnier the more you see it.Dana Carvey is an absolute brilliant comedian and this movie SHOULD HAVE been his gateway to super stardom (i.e. Jim Carrey). Unfortunately the movie really isn't very good and it shows upon first view. But give it a chance and watch it with you kids and I bet you'll be pleasantly surprised at how much you like it and want to watch it again.

This movie is aimed at kids but I think many adults can get a kick out of it too.  Dana Carvey is always funny on TV or on the big-screen, and it was a treat to see some new material from him.  This film is full of good messages and has a fantasy element to go along with great comedy.  The bonus footage during the credits is very funny.  I can't wait to see what comes next from the comedic mind of Dana Carvey.

I found this movie to be funny, fun, light-hearted, cute, and entertaining. If you are a kid or a kid at heart (as I am), you will enjoy this one.I laughed out loud on several occasions, and I left the theater with a good feeling.My husband went to the theater with no expectations, and we left glad that we had given "Master of Disguise" a try.  And, no, we didn't go just because of the kids.  We are both adults, and we don't have any kids.  We just enjoy seeing good, wholesome movies.If you are hard hearted or the type who doesn't like goofy movies, you may not like it.  But I personally enjoyed it tremendously!

I wanted so badly for this to be a movie with some enriched semblance of soul. Something substantive to say -yeah that's a good story, and a film that cohesively weaves Carveys talents into an entertainment for kids (PG). Unfortunately by the Bo Derrick cameo (what kid of 8 would relate to that, and what would a parent tell a kid of 8 how they related to Bo-D's 10 poster? It could be funny but lacked any follow through and unity, despite the 1979 reference) followed by the never ending slapping, slapping, slapping that ran throughout the film - I felt something was amiss followed by compounding disappointment.----------------- In brief: Disappointed that the Disquisiey family setting lacked warmth and believability, disappointed in the one dimensionality of all the female characters ("you disgust me" said grandpa D to Pistachio's assistant after she asks about her new jobs benefits), and the tenets that seeing Carvey gaze into space after being dope slapped (yet another time) is enough to make me believe that this is acceptable because he plays it cute, and in the big picture -substantive enough to carry the thinning story line to its blunt and anti climactic end.---------------- The theater I went to had about 35 to 50 suburban (Colma CA.) kids (ages 7 to 13) in it and the only laughs came from the predictable fart's that the bad guy let go from his own jokes, and excitement (and these laughs were slow in coming i.e., four fart's in).  Other wise the theater sat silently.-------------- I'm going to like to think that the outcome of this production this is not reflective of Carveys innate talent, but perhaps it is the result of having been surrounded by a few too many "yes men, and women" when putting this one together. --------------

reviews.review_title: You can't over think this movie.
reviews.content: This movie may not be the greatest movie ever but I got a kick out of it when i watched it.  Basically it was so stupid it was funny. If you are a person like me that likes stupid movies you will enjoy this one.  It's the kind of movie you watch when you are bored on a friday night.

Judging by the fact that there are positive reviews of this movie it is obvious that the studios plant comments.  This is hands down the worst movie I have ever paid to see in a theater.  It was worse than 'Showgirls'.  It was worse than Madonna's 'Truth or Dare'. This is not a "kids movie" that I just didn't get, I love kids movies.  This is not a matter of not liking Dana Carvey, in the past I have loved his work, even the ones that bombed in the theaters.  This movie was just plain awful.  Everyone associated with this thing should be ashamed.  If you take your child to see this you will be insulting his/her intelligence.

He may play a master of disguise, but there's no disguising the fact that Dana Carvey has a date with Oscar next February. Oooooof! Genius hardly begins to describe Mr. Carvey's bravura yet subtle acting style. At one point I thought I was watching an actual Turtle Man! Brilliant! See it again and again!

You might expect a movie produced by Adam Sandler and starring Dana Carvey to be really, really bad - and you would not be disappointed with Master of Disguise. From an uninspiring beginning that leaves you wondering why you should care about any of the characters through a bunch of overdone slapstick and pre-adolescent humor, including an interminably-repeated fart joke, this one is a dog.The only redeeming qualities this movie has are the underutilized talents of Brent Spiner and the delightful, gorgeous and talented Jennifer Esposito, who pulls off the only decent performance in the film.Let's put it this way: Jesse Ventura has a cameo, and the rest of the movie makes his cameo a high point. 'Nuff said.

reviews.review_title: This has become one of my guilty pleasures!
reviews.content: Relax - enjoy this film. It isn't sophisticated, it isn't art, but everyone involved goes for it full speed, and it is really pretty funny. You either get the joke or you don't, but it isn't the horrible train wreck that some are making it out to be, one of the "third worst comedies of all time", as has been quoted. And contrary to some other reviews, Dana Carvey does spend a good amount of time in disguise throughout the film. My particular favorites are the Turtle Man and Gammy Num-Nums.I will admit that some of the disguises will go over the young one's heads, but the adults will get it and the kids will still laugh.This film is best described as being many of the things you never thought someone would have the guts to do - and then did. I can't wait for my son to get a little older so I can show this to him.

As bad as bad can be.  Simply amazing how terrible this movie was...  I am even ashamed to say that I saw it for free.  True, I expected it to be "bad," but it surpasses this characterization beyond any movie I think that I have ever seen.  The purest of pure dungus...  Baffling.... Utter spunk.

reviews.review_title: one or two good lines, and that's about it
