reviews.content: I saw the trailer for this movie, and thought it might be good.  I liked Dana Carvey in some Saturday Night Live stuff, and particularly Wayne's World, but this movie didn't cut it.  I think the key to this was that Dana Carvey was the writer for Master of Disguise.  He acts well to well written material, but he's not much of a writer.  Generally, the dialogue just got old and irritating really quickly, and was just not very funny.  He really tended to overdo things that may have been funny for a little while, but they went on longer than they should.

Actually, that might be a bit overstated, I'm not entirely sure the people behind this movie were really trying to make a good movie. This movie seems to me to be a textbook example of Rat Race Syndrome, wherein you get a whole bunch of A-List actors in an effort to make up for a plot which is at its essence crap. However, there's only one thing that keeps this from being such a movie: Good actors. Sure, Dana Carvey did a brilliant job with what was handed to him and probably deserves praise for his performance in this god-awful movie. Everyone else, though, came across simply terrible in their efforts, which, I would suspect, were minimal to begin with. As a result, there is the sad likelihood that this movie has ruined Dana Carvey's career. I haven't seen him resurface since this movie, though perhaps I am not looking hard enough. However, I would completely understand him not wanting to show his face anywhere after this extraordinarily terrible movie.

reviews.review_title: Rating too low, film not as bad as rating
reviews.content: I find this movie to be not as bad as the rating. Come to think of it, I enjoy it more than other mindless comedies like Zoolander, The Hot Chick, or the one that Aston Kutcher did (the title of which I forgot). With this one I did laugh once, in the cobra snake scene, and giggled a few times in several scenes. Of course there are lame moments here and there, but overall I think kids will like it.Poor Spiner though, he only gets to do 1 joke, which is repeated way too many times.Unfortunately, many people seem to really hate this movie and give it a rating of "1", skewing the total rating of this movie into the Bottom 100.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: This movie is just plain bad. I am a former fan of Carvey, and I usually enjoy movies that are pretty simple minded, but this movie left me feeling angry and cheated.  The humor in this movie is so bad and out-dated that even little children will be bored by it.  It might have been a little funnier back in the early 90s, with such over-used phrases like "whose your daddy" and frequent fart jokes, but they just aren't funny nowadays. The movie lacked any sort of coherency or point--it seemed to be a mishmash of unfunny spoofs and take-offs of various well known movies, many of which the target audience probably hasn't seen yet.  This movie seemed to be an excuse for Carvey to show off his impersonations.  They were funny on SNL, but they just don't work on the screen.  He says that he designed the movie cause he thought his kids would like it, but that's the problem, HIS kids are the only ones who will probably really enjoy this.  This movie seemed to be one big inside joke, and a bad one at that.  Plus, the shameless inclusion of well known celebrities was pointless.  At least the Austin Powers films actually put famous celebrities to good use.  I will say that without a doubt this is the worst movie of the year.  I don't recommend this movie to anyone, even if you are a Carvey fan.

I saw this film yesterday with my 7yo son, and it is rubbish.I get to see a lot of kids movies and I usually can get a laugh or two but this was amazing for it complete lack of humour.Don't see it it will only encourage them to make a sequel :-)

reviews.review_title: I can't believe this was released!
reviews.content:
This is the weakest film I have seen for a long time. All of the 'set-piece' jokes such as the Turtle guy completely fell flat. I watched this at my friend's house with a few others and the only funny things we were seeing were each other's reactions to this shoddy film. Even at just £2.95 on DVD (less than $5 for you American readers) to buy this was a waste of money. The best part of the DVD was the deleted scenes, namely the Mayor Maynot scene which despite being the funniest scene that was filmed by an absolute mile, still managed to end up on the cutting room floor.
I dread to think what was going through the heads of the producers when they were making this. Surely they must have realised that it was complete crap before they even got the cameras out. Or maybe not as on the DVD commentary they talk about the film like it's a masterpiece. I'm not going to say this is the worst film ever, because it isn't, but it isn't far off either.Perhaps Dana Carvey should have disguised his name as well as I can't see a career recovery after this blunder.

reviews.review_title: Liked it as a kid, as an adult...
reviews.content: Despite what many critics say about it, I don't think this film was THAT bad, but still. Watching it in the theater with my cousin and little brother at the time, all everyone did was laugh. At school, me and my friends used to repeat the jokes and gags we remembered. In my eleven year old mind at the time, I actually thought we were laughing at the funny scenes. It was literally one of the funniest movies I watched. However, watching it again seven years later as a college freshman, I realized everyone, especially the adults were laughing at the over done gags, poor acting, and really childish style the film was made. Really the previews and TV spots showed all the funny parts and the rest of the film was just as bad as a straight to DVD Disney sequel. There were some scenes in there that I thought was to over the top like changing into a new costume in a matter of seconds even more annoying than the last. Jokes at the start of the film I realized on the second time watching it, were recycled through out the entire film like the villain's constant farts after his maniacal laughs. I didn't even laugh once like my eleven year old self almost died of in the theater. I really was surprised to read that Rotten Tomatoes rated this in the 100 worst movies of the decade, but I guess a lot can change in seven years regarding as to what some sees as funny and over the top. I would say don't even bother renting it, but I see no need because it's nowhere to be found.

This is one of the few films that made me mad ... not for any reason other than that it took away time from my life when I could have been doing something else. Don't get me wrong -- Dana Carvey is a talented guy, but this movie was simply stupid and unfunny. Just to clarify, I'm one of the few people I know of who actually *enjoyed* OPPORTUNITY KNOCKS ... and I still found MASTER OF DISGUISE to be very hard to stomach. Stay away from this one ... even if you don't have to pay any money to see it.

It is a mystery to why I bothered even watching this film because I knew perfectly well that any film shown at 3 o'clock is not going to be remotely entertaining. For a lack of anything better to do (this has to be the only reason for anyone watching it), I sat down and tried to take in this tripe.First of all, it is obvious that it is trying too hard to be funny and is blatantly copying features of respectable films e.g. SHREK and THE EXORCIST. Punchlines are too obvious, these half-baked jokes are unbearable and you wonder if the producers even bothered thinking about how the plot works. Also, someone in the production is totally obsessed with slapping people.I feel pity on the main character for being so embarrassing. He deserves better! Even though I have been only exposed to mostly decent films, this has to be one of the worst movies of all time.

reviews.review_title: A fun fluffy movie for the kid in all of us
reviews.content: Ok, first of all for the person who made the comment about the positive comments being proof of studio plants, I am not, I repeat, am not a studio plant. Good got that off my chest. Now on to the movie.  I laughed so hard, why you ask did I laugh so hard if the plot was fairly weak, and the characters not developed?  Because I didn't go to see some meaningful plot with amazing Oscar winning performances, I went to see Dana Carvey do what he does best, make me laugh!!!  It's kind of sad when our society needs either foul language, sexual content, or blood and gore to really get them excited(I mean come on, how much more plot and character development does Austin Powers have?) Anyway, some are going to get all upset because, how could I compare Austin Powers to this little movie, well let's see, Austin Powers is mostly about Mike Myers doing his schtick, except he has crude language, sexual innuendo and violence, Master of disguise is abot Dana Carvey being funny with very little sexual stuff(ok I know I know there ARE some scenes, but even that dosen't compare to Austin's blatent stuff) and some slapstick type violence(forgive the pun) Anyway, if you are a kid at heart, are a kid or have kids I think you'll like this movie.

"Masters of Disguise" is awful, and the blame rests squarely on the shoulders of its star and writer (Carvey). For someone so talented to have turned out a movie this bad is unbelievable, but make no mistake about it - this turkey is a tragic waste of 67 minutes of film stock.
Maybe it looked good on paper. I assume that this was intended as a vehicle for Carvey's talent for impressions. I expected something like the Seven Faces of Dr. Lao, or homage to Inspector Clouseau. Nope. With no plot, no character motivation, and flatulence jokes as the film's highpoint, this flick deserves a quick death. Jennifer Esposito has a thankless role, Harold Gould plays some weird grandfather-cum-Deus Ex Machina, and James (Mr. Barbara Streisand) Brolin looks virtually embalmed.The costumes, sets, makeup and costumes all point to a big budget, yet this film is so bad, you'd almost think they were making the script up as they went. Carvey seems destined for same fate Eric Idle has suffered through in his post-Python days.Do yourself a favor - wait for this one to hit the bargain rack at your favorite video emporium, then give it a miss.

reviews.review_title: It's worth at least a 6 , Personally i really enjoyed the impressions
reviews.content: This is a great movie for the whole family , If you can appreciate toilet humour and great impressions for what they are instead of looking for a deep meaningful comedy this is the movie for you, Still holds up after watching it a couple times over the years. Deserves less hate , there are a lot worse movies out there

I don't know what everybody is talking about. I'm 18 and in college and I'm still watching the movie and I think it's hilarious. I've seen it way more that any other movie out there. People just need a sense of humor and not be so serious. Obviously the acting isn't incredible but it's just clever enough to be freaking hilarious. I've never met anybody who doesn't think this movie is awesome. I'm just gonna write about random crap now cause I think that 10 lines is kind of ridiculous. I couldn't even write 10 lines about a classic like Mr. Bean. I can say what I want to say about a movie in about 4 lines. and there we go.

reviews.review_title: If Hell has movie theaters, this is what they show there
reviews.content: My friends and I have a tradition called "bad movie night." It's self-explanatory: we take turns finding a terrible movie, and we watch it and laugh our butts off at how crappy it is. When one of my friends showed up last night with this affront to all that is good and decent, we received much more than we bargained for.The jokes are terrible, even if you're 100% wasted. The dialog is lame at best, and actively painful at worst. The acting itself is sub-sub-par; as you watch you get the impression that all of the actors (aside from Dana Carvey, of course) are genuinely p*ssed off that they are in the movie at all. The only redeeming quality this movie has is that it is really, really short, but this is negated by the fact that those 80 minutes will feel like an eternity.If jokes that were never funny in the first place being repeated up to 8 times is your thing, look no further. If standalone fart noises - that is, an out-of-place fart noise unsupported by any action or dialog whatsoever - can make you laugh, this is definitely your film. If you absolutely hate your kids and want a divorce, grab this for a great family movie night... as for my friends and I, the second the store where we bought this last night opens we're going to try and get our 6 bucks back.

When Dana produced this movie, he wanted one that his kids could see without there being anything bad in it. When it came out, I was 18. Even though I knew it was going to be a kids movie, I still wanted to see it because of Dana Carvey. Being a kids movie and knowing his motivation, I wasn't expecting some blockbuster comedy that apparently most of the other critics of this movie were. It's a silly stupid kids movie with ridiculous slap stick! If you go into it expecting anything more than that last sentence, you are going to be disappointed. Otherwise, prepare for some good belly laughs! I came on here today to look up this movie again because a line popped into my head. If I had access to my parents' DVD collection, I'd be sitting down to watch it with my little girl tonight!!!

i went and saw this the night it came out (dont know why), it is easily the worst movie that's come out in a long time, chud 2 was more entertaining. even tho this was meant as a children's movie i wouldnt think even children would find it funny

In a world of horrible movies(rainman,braveheart,pulp fiction) you need a good movie once in a while. That's why this flick is so great. Whoever doesnt like it has a few screws loose and this movie should definetly win best picture at next years academy awards with no-contest whatsoever. 10 out of 10 for excellence. Great plot too!

I love funny, silly movies - but this film just doesn't work if you are an adult. The kids in the audience had a great time, and were laughing at everything. Dana Carvey is wonderful - his characters are great. But the script could have been better, and should have been written to appeal to adults as well as kids.

reviews.review_title: A rib tickler for the goof troops!
reviews.content: Ok honestly, it really wasn't what i would call a block buster hit or a million dollar sizzler, but come on it hits a funny nerve after a while. I'm very goofy and i actually liked the movie. As a matter of fact i always tune in when it comes on the popular movie channels. My little sister hates it, but it has some funny parts to me. Like i said its ridiculous, but its funny. Come on, if hollywood makes all the same action-packed, scarey, dramatic,romantic comedy tear jerkers all the time nobody would be thrilled to keep watching the same kinds of movies with similar parts from before? I love diffrent movies. Need i add that i'm also a fan of some of austin powers work!!!!!bye.

I've always been a Dana Carvey fan. He was funny on Saturday Night Live, funny in Wayne's World, and funny everywhere else that he wasn't bearing the full weight of a movie with the strength of his comedic ability.His big test came in Master of Disguise, and with it he flunked out of film school.Don't believe that just because you're a "comedy fan" (as one reviewer put it) that you'll somehow be rolling in the aisles at this. You won't. If you were in the theater, you'd probably walk out. Since you'll probably watch this at home, expect to walk out of your house, because the whole thing will be poisoned.The first poorly acted scene with legendary starlet Bo Derek was just a harbinger of things to come. Flailing confusion followed for the next 75 minutes, which seemed a stretched out version of a 45 minute script.The acting never convinced you of anything but the effect of weak directing. It was as if director Perry Blake was too afraid to tell his actors what to do. Few of them turned in a scene that didn't seem like a first take. The cameras just kept rolling anyway, perhaps trying to save money on film by not re-shooting anything.The costume-based jokes all fall flat in seconds. When a character is more creepy and awkward than funny, there's a problem. On a scale of 1 to 10, one being amusing and ten being creepy, the "Turtle Guy" scene was the proverbial 11. Note to all involved: A guy saying "turtle" in a weird sheepish voice isn't funny, and it certainly isn't funny when you've had him repeat it 20 times within five minutes as the only attempted joke in the entire scene.If the only comic relief next to the performance of confused, awkward "straight man" Jennifer Esposito is a guy repeating the same line over and over again, you're scraping the wood off the bottom of the laugh barrel. There's just nothing there to find remotely amusing. All the audience feels is pity for everyone involved in the movie, including themselves.That type of unnerving awkwardness repeats over and over again throughout the movie, halted only briefly by comedic gems left completely unexplored like the "Classmates.com" profile in which the evil villain (played by Brent Spiner, who once again had nothing to work with) gives away his entire plan.What you get is an unfunny, unbearable view of Dana Carvey and many of his cast mates committing career suicide right in front of you. If you want to watch a movie that makes you feel joy, laughter, intrigue, and other positive feelings, watch something else. If you want to ride a roller-coaster of unrequited emotion as you hope over and over again that Dana Carvey is funny for his own sake, only to be let down over and over again until you push the stop button, this one's for you. It's not funny; it's sad.

reviews.review_title: Have loved this movie since elementary school!!!
reviews.content:
I literally created an imdb account JUST to post a review of this movie because I love it SO much and it gets such bad reviews. I also have 4+ other friends who adore this movie to no end!! Yes, it is VERY silly and VERY stupid, that is the entire point. It is definitely suited for young young ages like elementary school, but, as I have learned, once you thoroughly enjoy this movie you never stop loving it. I'm now 17 and rewatched it with my friend, and we both had lots of laughs!!
The only thing I could say that's slightly negative about this movie is that you have to have a very specific type of humor to be an adult and really appreciate it. For example, if I saw this movie for the first time when im 20, it would not be too impactful the way it has been since I first saw it when I was younger (and the fart joke becomes a little overdone, but kids seriously LOVE it when jokes are repeated often since they have goldfish-attention-spans!). As a kids movie, this movie is 100% my favourite from my childhood! And since I have the type of humor that this movie consistently serves, it is one of my favorites still today.

This little movie has become one of our family's all time favorites. Honestly, we watch it over and over again, quote it to each other, show it to other people. No, it's not a great movie; but it is a funny movie. You just have to have a taste for silliness, a childlike taste.When the nefarious Devlin Bowman (Brent Spiner) kidnaps his legendary father (James Brolin), Pistachio Disguisey (Dana Carvey) has to learn the ways of "Energico" and go to the rescue -- not just of his parents but of numerous national treasures besides. Ably helped by an assistant Jennifer (Jennifer Esposito) and his mystical grandfather (Harold Gould), Pistachio slowly becomes the Master of Disguise.Carvey, who has always cracked me up anyway, whirls through an army of loopy characters -- Granny Num-Nums, Mr. Peru, Terry Suave, Constable Muller, Cherry Pie Man ("Look! It's Cherry Pie Man!," like everybody knows him), and the great Turtle Man. There are also Robert Shaw from Jaws and even President George W. Bush at a crucial moment.The DVD (yes, we own it) special features show those weren't all he had in mind -- Mayor Maynot is so well done, but was cut out completely, for instance.Special kudos to Spiner, who was evil, and Esposito, who played along hilariously. And the guy offering hors d'oeuvres to Mr. Peru, just for keeping a straight face.The Italian accents are uniformly awful, I'll admit, and the gags are sometimes dopey. But they're funny dopey, not painful dopey. If you're not too sophisticated to enjoy a simply enjoyable movie, rent this movie or pick it up for $5 at Half Price Books like we did. Watch it with some kids, about 10 years old. It will be difficult for you to stop laughing.

I used to love this movie as a kid. I think it's what got me into doing accents and silly voices. I used to quote what I could remember from it with a good friend back in highschool. I rewatched it again recently with my 6 year old sister, and when we got to the end she said "that was really dumb." And I had to agree. It was just plain unfunny. Even the things I've quoted over the years just weren't funny anymore. Just a bad movie that I wish my nostalgia goggles had protected a little more, I suppose.

I cant believe all the bad reviews and hate on Dana Carvey we think it was a very good movie and funny me and my kids still watch this movie matter of fact we watching it now while we put out this review. We enjoy every time we watch it and laugh.

The Disguise was effective, there could have been a 5 minute sketch hiding in there but you would have been hard pressed to identify it. I find it hard to find anything good to stay about this film except possibly the pain didn't last very long. The out takes during the end credits were probably funnier than the film but that isn't saying much.

reviews.review_title: Advertisements are the ONLY highlights... get back in your turtle shell.
reviews.content: Mindless drivel comes to mind... insult to one's intelligence is another, but I think I will stick with the word 'boring' to describe Master of Disguise.A friend rented Kung Pow: Enter the Fist a few months back and I thought of that as the worst movie I had seen next to Star Trek V: The Final Frontier... well Master of Disguise takes the cake, or turtle shell in this case. The commercials gave the impression of a very witty and funny Dana Carvey movie that was released about the same time as his friend Mike Meyer's movie, Goldmember. The problem is, the commercials WERE the movie. Any, and all funny material presented in the movie were contained in the 45 second spot that ran on TV. That means 79 minutes and 15 seconds of the movie were a complete waste of time.So much more could have been done with the premise of a 'Master of Disguise', but instead they made the movie into a borefest of awful acting, horrible cliches, and a running fart scene that popped up every time the villain, played by Star Trek's Brent Spiner, laughed and lost control of his bowels.If you wish to be entertained, I would recommend you watch Tombstone, Saving Private Ryan, or maybe endless re-runs of Lost in Space. To quote Dr. Smith from Lost in Space... "Oh the pain... oh the pain!" Master of Disguise rates a perfect score of ZERO in my book.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie ever made.
reviews.content: I've never written a movie review before but after watching this, I felt obligated to perform a public service. If it's any indication, my 4 year old daughter left the room 15 minutes in, I suspect she found it too immature. I lasted another 10 minutes (due to the fact that I'm not nearly as mature as most 4 year olds) before I turned it off. This is NOT the worst movie ever made, that movie was substantially better than this one. You have been warned. This line is filler because my review does not meet the 10 line requirement. I tried keeping this short because watching the show has wasted enough of my time already. Hopefully I can spare you some of yours.

reviews.review_title: The Only Disguise Is That It's Pony
reviews.content: Take 18 cans of lager & a film you have been waiting for from a guy you remember from Wayne's World - What do you get? Well very drunk & a bad head in the morning, not from the lager but from watching this film (i use the word "film" loosely). I got a email from a website all about the film & I thought it was quite good, when I saw it I changed my mind, from a film I wanted to watch, to a mess I wish I had never seen. From the beginning to about 40 minutes in, it is a mess, from wondering what the hell is happening to what the hell is going on.Sorry Dana, this film is the biggest pile of rubbish I have seen & I have seen Black Knight, but to be fair is does have it's moments, some funny bits, not laugh out loud, but bits you snigger at (i.e Brent Spiner who has got fat - Sorry Star Trek fans but the bloke is now a porker). If you like Dana then please please please do yourself a favour, view with caution, it's ok but it's not great (Dana tries to take Mike Myers on with his Shrek impression - my Nan can do a better one & she's never seen the film). This film has more turkey than Bernard Matthews. Nuff said.

reviews.review_title: That movie was the worst i ever see
reviews.content: That movie have with very stupid scenes and very basic characters. If you no have seven years or less do not watch this movie!Watch this was the perfect excuse to not study, but even so it was a big waste of time. In all the circumstances, that movie its a waste of time. The trailer it's so much fun that the movie, at Discovery Channel have better programs than this movie and very more funs, even the murder programsin resume, my advice is don't watch this movie, its the antithesis the commedia

reviews.review_title: I could not believe how bad this was !
reviews.content: I am only giving this movie a one out of ten because it actually finished before I ended up a drooling mess in the corner of the room .We found this 'comedy' on TV and thought we would give it a chance cos it had Dana Carvey in it and it might have been entertaining , how wrong we were . This movie was'nt funny , just inane , at one point a character has a disguise like grass with a cow poo for a face . The jokes and situations were weak and when it finished we were saying " what the hell was that all about " Sorry to say we found this a big waste of time , but my workmate told me her boyfriend really likes this movie , so I guess you should watch it and judge for yourselves .
Great for kids and family. Not sure why the scores are so low :-(

This is the Worst movie that I have ever seen! What a waste of time, could have been folding & matching socks. I emailed Dana Carvey to get my $6 back. This should be in the IMDb's Worst 100, near the absolute bottom 5. A man like Dana Carvey should have never done this film. Wouldn't waste a match to burn the original tape to prevent future watching. Rating this a minus 2 stars. This movie lacks any funny bits, direction, or a reason to stay awake. I took my son, age 12, to see this movie since he like TMNT's movies. Stay with the Teenage turtle movies. I expected to the appeal to kids, boys especially, and to adults with Mr. Carvey being in this flick. Not so, my son even wanted to leave movie after about 30-40 minutes in. Thought it would be better, failed. This clearly was the conversation in the Sony corporate 11th floor office,"Hey we have too much money into this piece of S%%# film, we have to release to try to re-coop what we paid Dana"

the stupidest movie ever made, but jennifer esposito is extremely hot. I expected better from Carvey, but not everyone is good at making movies alone. If he and Mike Myers were in it than it might be worth watching. I watched it in disguist and wanted to walk out.

reviews.review_title: Not even half as bad as it looked.
reviews.content: I guess most people watching this film will be expecting some sort of cross between Carvey's "Blank Slate" and his role of Garth in "Wayne's World".Unfortunately this movie is aimed at 8-12 year old kids and so fans may be disappointed. The jokes are usually immature sometimes and mainly consist of Carvey disguising himself as different wacky characters and doing impressions. Here is where the problem lies. While the impressions range from good (Tony Montana) to hysterically funny (Quint from Jaws) to downright surreal (Turtle Turtle) the plot in between and the actual jokes are a little on the poor side.The biggest problem is the editing. The third act in particular seems to have about 15 mins of plot sliced out of it and there are some noticeable holes in the story. In fact the whole ending seems to have not been completely filmed. This makes an already silly movie very difficult to follow at times and the film ends at just under 77 mins.Many of these faults could be attributed to the fact that the film is aimed at pre-teens, however in this case they have no excuse. Most of the cast are good comedic actors and watching this film you can see the humour trying to get out, you know this film could have succeeded if they had just tried a little harder.Instead we are left with a film that will make you laugh if you watch it with your kids, but will never fully entertain anyone, not even the audience it was intended for. 5 out of 10.

When I first saw a commercial about this movie i thought it would be funny. Trust me, it's not. All the good scenes are cut out because they are too "pg-13"ish. Trust me folks I couldn't wait to see it but then I finally saw it and now all i can do is say how dumb and storyless it is. I thought it was supposed to be like austin powers but its more like some cheap disney movie. The only thing good about this is Jennifer Esipito. 2 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: I WANTED to like this movie...
reviews.content: I watched this movie last night, and I really wanted to like it. Really, I did want to like it, I just couldn't. I tried to force myself to laugh in a couple of places, but I just wanted to punch Pistachio in the face. By the end, when he finally realizes his powers (it is so obvious, I wouldn't really call this comment a spoiler, but just in case....)the movie is slightly more interesting.One bright spot did exist - Jennifer Esposito was entirely cute. She has a genuinely attractive way about her that comes through loud and clear. However, she couldn't be cute enough to save this movie if there were three of her.Having said the above, I did wonder how an elementary age kid would have taken it. They might have liked it and thought it was funny, so if you have kids, it might be worth watching.

reviews.review_title: Only film I couldn't endure to finish, is horrible. Oh the humanity!
reviews.content: As I wrote this review, I realized I found my self in difficulty to find the correct words to describe how bad this movie is. As anyone else, I have favourite genres of film and there are of course some which I don't enjoy as much, some that I honestly don't like or appreciate, but in the end, I had always been able to watch any film from beginning to end, until I watch this film, I had to eject the DVD and stop watching, I was painful to endure, and ever since, I have been able to watch any film. This film was really a disappointing, considering how much enjoyed Dana Carvey's performances on SNL and in Wayne's World. The only advice that I can give to anyone, is to stay away from this film, as far away as one would try to stay away from Ebola.

Hilarious!! Such a great film!!! When I first saw Master of Disguise I was a little taken by surprise at the amount of slapstick comedy, and felt it went too over the top at times, as I had had doubts that this film was a little too young for me. But then I watched it again properly and it grew on me. I found that I enjoyed Dana Carvey's performance and realised that this film was funny, better than that. Harold Gould was the balance back from the comedy though also inputted some himself which I found was well put in. Brent Spiner as the "bad guy" was a perfect match and played his part brilliantly opposite Carvey, Gould and Brolin. This film was brought to its great level by the story and the way it appeals to children and Carvey's character with his simplicity. I also think this film was one of the great ways to allow Carvey to use his talent of impersonation in the big screen. I had personally not heard of him before this film and am now finding myself looking for more of his work. I have now watched the film quite a few times and still enjoy it. Anyone who has a great and slightly weird sense of humour like me should find it a laugh very enjoyable.

I saw the commercials for this movie, and it didn't look as horrible as it was. The movie was so lame and I have never seen anything worse in my life. I hope to god that nobody thinks that this is Dana Carveys best movie. If you think that, then this is the only Dana Carvey movie you have seen. He was great in Wayne's World and was probably the only thing that somebody liked about Master of Disguise. Dana Carvey plummeted in this movie, and it is so awful. Who wants to see a guy who farts every time he laughs? I'm not putting down all fart jokes, but that one was just lame. This is the lamest movie that I have ever seen and is good only to use as a Frisbee or coaster, and even then, you will be disappointed by this trash.

Without question the worst movie I have ever seen. Had the projector broke even 10 minutes before the end, it would have spared me another agonizing 10 minutes, as I could have cared less how the movie ended. Annoying characters, inane plot, and the scene in the Turtle Club made me want to vomit. This is truly a comedy without a single funny moment. The only reason to stay and watch even one moment of this bomb is the very beautiful Jennifer Esposito. I cannot say enough bad things about this movie. I have however recommeded this movie to several people; my ex-wife, mother-in-law, and other people I felt needed to be punished. You have been warned!!!

reviews.review_title: Nearly as bad as you've heard
reviews.content: Dana Carvey is an extremely talented individual, with a flair for voices and looks, the supporting cast all perfectly capable, and a rather impressive list of Celebrity Cameos, It took me a little while to work out why this movie is so bad. It is one of those movies where you can identify each and every joke, but you don't laugh at a single one of them. Kids will miss much of the "humour" and probably a lot of the fast spoken dialogue will whoosh over their heads, Adults will of course realise that comedy moved beyond fart jokes and silly voices. Its a shame that Carvey may end up being remembered for this, after such wonderful work on SNL and Waynes World. Lets hope he finds a better outlet some time soon...

The script is bad and the jokes and slapstick don't work, but the worst part of this movie is the truly annoying character voice that Dana's character uses throughout the movie. It was painful to sit through.The only mildly redeeming aspect was the endless stream of short comedy bites following the credits. They went on for so long and were almost as painful as the movie that my wife and I had to laugh. The movie just wouldn't end.

reviews.review_title: And The 2002 Razzie Award For Worst Picture Goes To...
reviews.content: Really, to think that Dana Carvey, a master comedian who was part of the best SNL cast ever (any SNL fan can back me up on that one,) was part of such a lousy film. Funniest thing in the film is the villain having a flatulence problem.

In this world today everyone is so cynical and serious. They need to lighten up and enjoy a silly movie from back in the day. I think it's funny and sure it can be silly, but that's the purpose of this film. I just wish all the other reviewers here would lighten up. It is a film filled with crude jokes at times, but it gives a lifetime of laughs with those you watch it with. It's great for the whole family to watch. It definitely will keep your attention and if you watching it again after years of having not seen it, all I can say is you won't be dissapointed. 10/10 fun movie that I quote still to this day.

I took my 10-year old nephew to see this whilst on holiday in the US. Either he's more mature than his years or the film-makers have seriously underestimated what people will find funny. Dana Carvey doing his own thing, the fart noises, etc - my nephew asked to leave after 30 minutes. A joke heard once is funny, a joke replayed over & over again is boring, and a poor joke replayed over & over again is insulting. Credit people with some intelligence, film-makers - if you want to make something that panders to the ego of particular actors with almost total disregard for the quality of the film as a whole, then advertise it as that & your audience will be selected/selective accordingly. This was a waste of money to make & a waste of money to watch.
Worst Movie Ever. Don't even bother wasting your money on this one.  Dana Carvy should be ashamed of himself for this worthless piece of trash.  After 15 minutes I wanted to leave the theater. 1/10

I just rented this on DVD. I am mystified as to why so many of the user comments were so scathing. This was meant to be nothing more than a goofy movie, like "Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein." You shouldn't expect a seamless plot or complex characters in a movie like this. I thought Dana's "Scarface" impersonation was brilliant, and Brent Spiner turned in a very funny -- but not over-the-top hammy -- performance (based on his work here, I wish he had been cast as Count Olaf; it would have been the perfect role for him). Look, I like witty repartee as much as the next person with a graduate degree, but fart jokes and Rob Schneider also crack me up (especially that scene where he's romancing the goat in The Animal). So sue me.

I think that this movie was really funny. At first i was not interested in it, but my friends made me go, and when i saw it, I went to go see it again next time. This movie was a really funny comedy, and i think that everyone should see it. This movie is "two thumbs up." I think that the movie would probably be the "funniest movie of the year."  Go see it, and trust me you will like it, because it is hilarious, and incredibly funny!!!!

reviews.review_title: I feel dumber for having seen this movie.
reviews.content: This is easily one of the top 5 worst movies of all time.  I wish I could have those precious minutes of my life back.  I think "The Onion" said it best, "DVD released with 83 minutes of previously unseen movie", and the movie was only 80 minutes long!

....if you are a boy aged between 4 and 10. At this age boys do not need to be lobotomised as they are already that daft. Every joke, skit and look is aimed at this age range and if that's too much for your sophisticated adult brain then shame on you. It was a joy to watch my 3 sons laughing and enjoying themselves so much. Dana Carvey's geek character is one that all small boys can relate to (trapped as they are in their own sometimes unresponsive bodies) and being the totally stupid good guy who wins, for me sends a better message than other kids movies that say the biggest bombs win.Who's the Daddy? Dana Carvey must be one for sure.

There can't be a movie worse than this. Why won't they let you enter a vote less than 1? This movie makes battlefield earth look like Casablanca. I've watched a lot of children's movies with my son, and none are as bad as this, so this movie can't be for children. sometimes you watch a movie and want your money back, but you can't put a price on the anguish that this causes. All parties responsible for making this should be locked up so they can't hurt us again. The instructional video that they show new employees at Kinko's to clear a paper jam is The Godfather compared to this pile of crap. Whenever Goodfellas or Casino comes out, Italian-American groups complain about negative stereotypes, but Dana Carvey's character is called Pistachio Disguisey, and talks with a corny pseudo-Italian accent, and nobody says a word. I'm not Italian, but if I was, I'd rather have people think I'm a gangster than a no talent hack named pistachio disguisey. If anyone needs to sleep with the fishes, it's anyone associated with the making or distribution of this so-called film.

This was easily the worst movie I have ever had to sit through.I was felt very embarrassed for Carey. I was so looking forward to it as I was really likes his nerdish and shy character in the waynes world movies. Not only what was he thinking but also what was he doing in half of the scenes? Did he do half of them himself or did the director also go to sleep with his performance and not yell cut ? ? ?PLEASE LET ME FORGET THIS QUICKLY.

This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The DVD should come with a warning label "WARNING: If watched, INDUCE VOMITING!!!" I felt truly let down by Dana Carvey, as I hold him in high regard due to his work in the "Wayne's World" movies. Also the preview for the film had good jokes in it... WHICH WERE NOT INCLUDED IN THE FILM!!! I saw the preview and found myself laughing hysterically at some of Dana's remarks and looking forward to seeing the movie (little did I know that such jokes as "the Neapolitan ice-cream" debate would be omitted to make room for crap like the fart jokes involving the ridiculous villain).

reviews.review_title: "Master of Disgust" is a more suitable title.
reviews.content: Of all the bile-inducing vomitoriums to squeeze out of Tinseltown's bloody sphincter over the past 50 years, this is indisputably the worst of the lot. Carvey's one-man show is such a poor excuse for comedy that it doesn't even deserve to get raked by the MST 3000 crew. I swear, I actually felt nauseated after watching this festering pile of manure. In order to lengthen the lame 70-minute running time, the producers padded the end credits to TEN minutes with lame-ass Carvey impressions that surely couldn't even make the last few minutes of that God-awful Saturday Night Live TV show. In it you can see Carvey imitating other notable actors who surely don't deserve the indignity. Did I mention it features Jessica Simpson in a cameo? Yech!! If you ever plan on watching this stinking puke-fest, you might want to make sure you have plenty of Pepto-Bisthmol beforehand.

But not because it succeeds in the jokes that it tries to land or any attempts at humor that it tries to make.
No, this movie is absolutely hysterical in just how unfunny it really is.
I can't really put into words how I felt after watching this, but it was somewhere between throwing myself in front of a car, or finding and beating the nearest living thing into submission out of fear and anger.
Don't watch this. Not even as a joke, like I did.

reviews.review_title: The BEST, well. my comments are...
reviews.content: All right, I watched this today hoping to find the humor that Dana is known for, and I was sadly disappointed, OK, granted I was not expecting Waynes World.. but I think it could have been better.. who knows, I think it was a sign of the pending doom when I saw it was a Happy Madison production.. (that is for another time) His impressions were always the reason I watched him on SNL.. (Saturday Night Live for those who are Comic impaired) I also agree with another comment about studios wasting money on people that were huge in SNL without seeing a script.. had they read this one the movie might not have been made. and as a hard core Trekkie I found Brent Spiners role.... intriguing.. to say the least.. and the fart jokes.. OK.. the first couple made me laugh.. but I was really expecting them to go somewhere.. HA..Oh well I had to give it a 10 just to save it from the bottom of the list, but a 4 may be more than it deserves

Okay...so The Master of Disguise doesn't have the greatest plot.  But just because a movie doesn't have a good plot does not always mean that it isn't good.  The Master of Disguise is a comedy movie.  That's what we have to look at it as.  The majority of all comedy movies don't have very good plots-mostly because their meant to be funny-not to have a good plot. I've watched The Master of Disguise a minimum of 25 times, and I still enjoy watching it.  The humor never gets old.  So give The Master of Disguise a break, people...it's a comedy, not some action-adventure movie.

This is one of the worst movies I have seen in years, if not ever.  It is sad that such a good comedian as Dana Carvey should have made this movie. I knew we were in trouble when his father in the movie came out and it was James Brolin, supposedly an Italian!  And, when "Data" from Star Trek's most important role in the movie was to fart.   Avoid this movie like the plague. The trailer made it seem funny, but the trailer contained EVERY funny joke from the movie, and somehow the jokes seemed a lot less funny in context. This is a real turkey.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst... not from this year... EVER!
reviews.content: I can't believe I actually sat through the whole thing.  My 6 year old even thought it was bad.  It is possibly the worst movie I have ever had the misfortune to spend good money on.  I found myself discussing movies like "Plan 9 from Outer Space" with my wife on the way home.  At least "Plan 9" was funny.Dana Carvey is generally funny, and this might have been funny as a Saturday Night Live sketch, but it wears on the nerves.  The character played by Carvey comes across as stupid with few redeeming traits that make you want to see his life get better, and for the most part he doesn't get any smarter.And just like a bad SNL sketch, you wish you could fast forward to the next sketch, unfortunately there isn't one.

This movie is one of the worst movies i have ever seen (including Eddie Murphy's "Holy Man") and seeing it surely was the most wasted hour and a half of my life. Although Dana Carvey is a good impresionist, it doesn't mean a movie should be made about it. The movie had a few funny moments but they couldn't save it from the rest of it. I still don't understand why celebrities like Michael Johnson and Bo Derek agreed to take a part in this HORRIBLE production.

reviews.review_title: So ... I don't think it's "supposed" to be all that good
reviews.content: While this isn't an apex comedy that will go down in history as a classic - many years later my family and I still quite parts of the movie and laugh.Not sure if we are laughing with it or at it - but we're laughing.It's over-the-top ridiculous. There are some cringe moments - that somehow get into your head.So I rated it a little higher - just to draw attention to it a bit :)

This was a terrible movie right from the start, and when it got to the point where I was laughing because of how crappy it was, I simply left the theatre and went and got my money back. I then went and rented another movie, just to get the cappiness that I had just viewed out of my mind.

reviews.review_title: Only a child would find Carvey's performance funny
reviews.content: This had to have been made for children, because I can't believe that Carvey would think that his sight gags are funny.  Brent Spiner completly upstages Carvey in the comedy department, he at least made me laugh... once.  This movie is completly forgettable.  It is a waste of time and money, and Carvey should be sentenced to public service for the psycological damage he's inflicted on all who've seen this movie.

The saddest thing about flix like this (call 'em "Movies for Morons") is that it basically assumes that its target audiences have the brains of mosquitos, and are making films to relate to the mentally challenged.Hey, making general audience/family flix is a good thing, and there are dozens of examples of great recent films that are kid-friendly but don't insult the intelligence of kids or their parents.This one decided not to go in that direction...God knows why.

I went to the theater to see this movie and I regret it. It was a waste of money. There were some funny parts but not many. Though I do think it would be funny for little kids or stupid teenagers. This movie was my last hope for a good comedy. I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone that I like, but maybe someone I hate.

When I first saw the previews, I thought that the movie would be good, but... no. I was really disappointed when I saw it. The movie turned out to be a family film that focused on entertaining younger viewers(Or, well tried). The movie would have been better as an independant movie on a kid's TV network.  70 minutes is pretty short and most of it is the characters rambling on about stuff. The plot is very weak and the characters aren't planned out well. Definately not worth the $6 you pay at the cinema.  Wait untill it airs on cable TV so you can just turn off the TV if you get sick of it.
